Tried to run the code and found it still doesn't work."}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2014-07-17 16:20:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 33: Code-Review-2

(7 comments)

The changes to ML2 port binding for DVR need to be reworked based on the recent changes that move ML2 port binding outside transactions. I'd also like to avoid exposing the binding model class(es) to mechanism drivers, since this should not be part of a semi-stable driver API.

Ideally, we'd find a way to support more general distributed port bindings in ML2 that would meet the needs of DVR and maybe also be useful for things like DHCP and advanced services. We may not be able to completely accomplish that in these initial patches due to time constraints, but should at least give that some thought and see if we can set things up to evolve towards a more general solution in the future."}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2014-07-17 17:22:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 33:

Along with the previous comments, I'm wondering if we could somehow share the PortBinding model/table between normal bindings and distributed bindings by adding a new field that is part of the primary key, and is empty for normal bindings and contains the host_id for distributed bindings.

A bigger issue is whether the portbinding extension attributes (vif_type, vif_details, profile, vnic_type, and host_id) can be well-enough-behaved for distributed bindings. Since ML2 supports heterogeneous deployments, and also with recent additions such as SR-IOV support, it seems that these attributes need to be unique for each host within a distributed binding. Returning the correct values from a create or update operation that supplies the host_id as an input should work, but what about get operations, and update operations that don't specify a host_id as input? Which host's binding values get returned/used in these?

I'm starting to think that the portbinding extension should be re-done as a sub-resource of port, with separate bindings for each host in a distributed port binding. This also might be useful for VM migration, where the bindings for the old and new hosts could co-exist for some period of time.

-Bob"}, {'account_id': 9361, 'date': '2014-07-17 17:59:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 33: Code-Review-1

Robert,

Thanks for the comments.  Fundamentally, this is probably first instance in neutron where we tried to accomodate these goals:
a. The DVR Router should be transparent to the tenants.  Basically when creating a router, the underlying configuration will decide if it will be hosted as DVR  (or) classic router.
b.  In order to maintain the above transparency, replicated bindings of a single router interface port in a DVR needs to be maintained and managed, without affecting existing original port binding logic used elsewhere prevalently in neutron.

In order to satisfy the above goals, we took to separate out the replicated DVR bindings into ml2_dvr_port_bindings rather than combining them with original port bindings.

It also helped us to conquer the replicated port bindings with minimal affect to existing port-binding creation/management and retrievals.

That said, I agree with you that port bindings need to be sub-resources of port and we will need to gradually evolve framework to allow multiple such portbindings for single Port resource.  I am not sure if twisting the existing portbinding to handle replicated bindings for DVR is a good path forward.

- Vivek'}, {'account_id': 9361, 'date': '2014-07-17 18:00:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 33: -Code-Review

Also changes to port-bindings have ripple effect till mechanism drivers which are partly vendor owned.  This additionally drove us to separate out DVR port bindings as DVR in current state works only for ML2/OVS.'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2014-07-17 19:18:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 33:

(14 comments)

Hi Bob,

I addressed the inline comments you had. As for the larger comments you brought up, you're right: DVR has unveiled the need of a more cohesive and aligned approach for dealing with port bindings; since achieving this goal may take some time (and we'd still want DVR to progress), in my opinion we need to identify what are the steps that are absolutely needed in your view for this patch to progress in the context of Juno and the other DVR patches, and what are the steps that will let evolve where you would like the port binding story to be. For instance, you hinted that the port-binding extension may need to be revisited in light of SRIOV, distributed bindings etc. Wouldn't this be scope for blueprint work?"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2014-07-18 04:50:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 34.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-18 04:50:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 34:

commit_message:
ML2 additions to support DVR

This patch introduces the changes necessary to
support DVR at Layer 2 with ML2, and L2pop.

Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-ovs-dvr

Change-Id: I709d877e7df83728868e68e023e6a37bb2e11704
Authored-by: Vivekanandan Narasimhan <vivekanandan.narasimhan@hp.com>

"}, {'created': '2014-07-23 17:37:49.000000000', 'message': "Add MacAddressInUseClient exception handling

commit_message:
Add MacAddressInUseClient exception handling

Nova needs a specific client exception defined for the server's
MacAddressInUse exception when allocating ports so it can handle the
exception properly, otherwise the NeutronClientException with a 409 can
be confused with other errors.

Partial-Bug: #1347778

Change-Id: Ia02dbc8fe32a43adeb229e3b640b9b33ec0dd6c7

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2014-06-12 02:40:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi ZhiQiang Fan,

Thanks for cleaning this up.  I do have a concern however; I find it useful to be explicit in the files like this so there's no question regarding the default = None.

It's akin to the argument of unused variables being captured from the returned tuple of a method (out, err) = do_something().

err is almost never used and based on things like pylint it's considered bad form.  On the other hand however many like the explicit nature of having the variable there

I realize this is not necessary and is redundant, but I'm wondering if there's any disadvantage to having a default of None explicitly set?  I don't believe there is.  Thoughts?  Thoughts from other reviewers/preferences?  

If the overwhelming thought is to nix declaring these we should create a hacking rule so they don't inadvertently come back and to eliminate confusion in reviews."}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2014-06-12 03:26:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree with John.  If this was a bug (I doubt it), create a hacking rule and fix it there.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-12 03:51:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-12 02:00:45.000000000', 'message': "remove default=None for config options

In the cfg module default=None is set as the default value. It's not
necessary to set it again when defining config options.

Change-Id: I726aaf227f084bc678b53edd144dfe58b7907160
Closes-Bug: #1323975
"}]
commit_message:
remove default=None for config options

In the cfg module default=None is set as the default value. It's not
necessary to set it again when defining config options.

Change-Id: I726aaf227f084bc678b53edd144dfe58b7907160
Closes-Bug: #1323975

commit_message:
minor fixes for cisco nexus ml2 plugin

This fix resolves the issue where the ssh keyscan
uses username instead of ip address and clean up
unneeded file path code.

Change-Id: Ie6c7889937f56b40dc72b551eb859dfc2d670193

commit_message:
The schedule triggers need to setup admin context before run.

The workbook_get db api will use 'project_id' to filter workbook.
We have to well setup intial admin context before periodic task.

Change-Id: I45c4d6bb30b215fdd681fc01606e829cf6def93e
Closes-Bug: #1335758

commit_message:
Remove mox dependency

This seems to have been inherited rather than ever actually used. We
should only be using mock for testing.

Change-Id: Ib37bf796560138077c96458dbcd9886dcacebd2e

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

Arch Design: X-as-a-Service hyphens

a mixture of these spellings.

commit_message:
Adds a sentence about Compute API v2 and v3 XML deprecation

 - for requests and responses in the Compute APIs

Also, use clouddocs-maven-plugin 2.1.2.

Change-Id: I1cd2e04e4634180141e67c277a6d9607ecfb23d9
Partial-Bug:1283341

messages:
[{'account_id': 167, 'date': '2014-07-26 20:31:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-26 20:31:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-26 20:33:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded.

- gate-openstack-doc-tools-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/25/109825/1/check/gate-openstack-doc-tools-pep8/f4c8841 : SUCCESS in 2m 04s'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2014-07-27 04:56:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

What's the benefit of this? I don't see a reason for this - not even one stated in the commit message.

Will the file be part of binary packages and get installed this way?"}, {'account_id': 11109, 'date': '2014-07-27 18:54:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

For what it's worth, I like having release notes that announce important changes (unlike the git log), and I prefer having those notes in a separate file, whether it's called ReleaseNotes (like in ceilometer) or ChangeLog. But that doesn't seem to be a popular view in OpenStack projects."}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2014-07-27 21:17:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I want to move the release notes into a separate file because the page on PyPi (https://pypi.python.org/pypi/openstack-doc-tools/0.16.1) is very long and I think that the release notes are not necessary to be inside the README file. I should add this to the commit message.

Have not yet thought about the delivery of the release notes in binary packages. Is it necessary?

The name of the file can be changed. I think CHANGELOG is better than RELEASE_NOTES.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2014-07-28 05:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

The file name is fine.

But it should be part of a source or binary release. So, please run setup.py install etc and ensure that the file get installed and shows up in the documentation.

Marking as WIP since this needs further changes.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2014-07-28 15:24:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-28 15:24:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2014-07-28 15:27:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Changed name to neutron-agent-dhcp in the command chmod and crm

Changed name to neutron-agent-dhcp in the command chmod and crm
Fixed the underscore error in the resource file at parameter plugin_config

Closes-bug: 1316006

Change-Id: I8f92ef7ee9eb04dbfa9c6f091186aa13bc5ed668

commit_message:
Updated description of create volume type dialog

The existing description is not very helpful, it does not metion
the extra specs that users need to deal with in order to make the
volume type usable.

Updated the description to guide users to set up the extra specs
in Horizon UI.

Closes-Bug: #1325726

Change-Id: I68db21cb45e6fa787ae4845aa8690ab6185dbed8

[{'created': '2014-07-23 00:41:05.000000000', 'message': "Move PATH set earlier

Checking the logs for a f20 run you'll see

---
 + ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh
 sudo: service: command not found
 22 Jul 21:24:41 ntpdate[1551]: adjust time ...
 sudo: service: command not found
---

We already went through this path issue with [1] so just move it
earlier before anything runs

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/91655/

Change-Id: Ie6bd27342b0ba0f0fba0a1d3695f108128d4366e
"}]
commit_message:
Move PATH set earlier

Checking the logs for a f20 run you'll see

---
 + ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh
 sudo: service: command not found
 22 Jul 21:24:41 ntpdate[1551]: adjust time ...
 sudo: service: command not found
---

We already went through this path issue with [1] so just move it
earlier before anything runs

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/91655/

Change-Id: Ie6bd27342b0ba0f0fba0a1d3695f108128d4366e

commit_message:
Use keystoneclient fixtures in middleware tests

Convert the static tokens in auth_token middleware tests to use
keystoneclient fixture generators.

We still have fairly static entries for the values in the tokens because
of the way the tests work.

Change-Id: Id6ee0389e063d6476d9c33c3d955926655c8ca75

commit_message:
Create new IPv6 attributes for Subnets by client

This is the client implementation of bp ipv6-two-attributes.
Add two optional arguments:
 --ipv6-ra-mode
 --ipv6-address-mode

Partially implements bp ipv6-two-attributes

Change-Id: Ia922a9b6bb4e1dbd372174d48f29f5411c7b5674

commit_message:
Move CommandFailed exception to tempest.exceptions

When the CommandFailed exception was added it was only being used by
the CLI tests. However, it is generally useful for anything that is
using subprocess to make external calls. This patch moves it to
tempest.exceptions to make using it simpler for non-cli tests to use
the exception.

Change-Id: Ibf5f1cbbb847d32976b54c4484acfc3c0e3b4f48

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-24 23:48:28.000000000', 'message': 'Add destroy_server to javelin2

To make it easier to test and debug the create_server logic, add in the
destroy_server logic.

Change-Id: I97092a817db66b52b50eab26714e76c69e25e228
'}]
commit_message:
Add destroy_server to javelin2

To make it easier to test and debug the create_server logic, add in the
destroy_server logic.

Change-Id: I97092a817db66b52b50eab26714e76c69e25e228

commit_message:
Add logs to javelin2

Make it easier to understand what is happening during a create,
especially how to detect when a create is short circuited.

Change-Id: I60f96fa14406be5ec965389ca80e337c0d62ca54

[{'created': '2014-07-28 17:36:21.000000000', 'message': "Get updated model info on volume transfer

On some drivers CHAP credentials are tied to accounts
which may be unique for each OS and/or backend Tenant.

For example:
  Volume is created with project_id xyz
  Backend creates an account for xyz with specific CHAP

  Volume is transferred to project_id abc

Currently we don't update the model_info, so even though
on the backend we updated the owner and CHAP settings we
never propogated that back up to the DB object so the volume
can't be used by the new owner.

This patch just adds an ensure_export call to get updated
model info after the accept_transfer call and updates the
info in the DB accordingly so all of the volume records
reflect the new owner.

Change-Id: Ie0447cdad69c4fbee99b4b6b1d3cacdfdd14137d
Closes-Bug: #1349475
"}, {'created': '2014-07-28 21:34:38.000000000', 'message': "Get updated model info on volume transfer

Currently we don't update the model_info, so even though

commit_message:
Get updated model info on volume transfer

On some drivers CHAP credentials are tied to accounts
which may be unique for each OS and/or backend Tenant.

For example:
  Volume is created with project_id xyz
  Backend creates an account for xyz with specific CHAP

  Volume is transferred to project_id abc

Currently we don't update the model_info, so even though
on the backend we updated the owner and CHAP settings we
never propogated that back up to the DB object so the volume
can't be used by the new owner.

This patch just adds an option to return model_update
on the accept_transfer call to the driver and updates
the db accordingly.

Also adds a call in the SF driver to actually get the
new model info to be fed back to the manager.

Change-Id: Ie0447cdad69c4fbee99b4b6b1d3cacdfdd14137d
Closes-Bug: #1349475

commit_message:
Upgrade, increased timeout for health checker

Sometimes during the testing some of the
after upgrade checkers fails. Increased
timeout to 15 minutes.

Change-Id: I5af19ed50ec9c82940eebcdfe970d51a56f64d55
Closes-bug: #1342723

l2pop mech driver.

As a result, some docstrings were reworded, and the newly
introduced properties used directly in the mech drivers.

Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-ovs-dvr
Supports blueprint: ml2-hierarchical-port-binding

Change-Id: If2a373ef04d19b164585fb4bde4fe6e0cfaf43be
'}]
commit_message:
Encapsulate some port properties in the PortContext

Bindings to host or status may need further encapsulation
to avoid exposing mechanism drivers to underlying DB model
details. This was particularly true in the case of the
l2pop mech driver.

As a result, some docstrings were reworded, and the newly
introduced properties used directly in the mech drivers.

Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-ovs-dvr
Supports blueprint: ml2-hierarchical-port-binding

Change-Id: If2a373ef04d19b164585fb4bde4fe6e0cfaf43be

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-24 23:48:28.000000000', 'message': "Make javelin2's ping wait 60 seconds

use ping's '-w' flag to wait 60 seconds before exiting.
Now ping will wait 60 seconds for a single response. This makes it
possible to run check right after a create.

Change-Id: If05c373f30f515af82fecf2347d7f7c1a5824287
"}, {'created': '2014-07-25 01:15:01.000000000', 'message': "Make javelin2's ping for longer

gets a response or until x seconds pass, use a python loop to do it
instead.

Change-Id: If05c373f30f515af82fecf2347d7f7c1a5824287

commit_message:
Make javelin2's ping for longer

Since as far as I can tell ping doesn't have a good way to ping until it
gets a response or until x seconds pass, use a python loop to do it
instead.

Change-Id: If05c373f30f515af82fecf2347d7f7c1a5824287

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-25 21:48:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for revoking a V2 token without validating first

The server was failing to revoke a V2 token if it was revoked before
validating it first. This is because when the server converted the
V2 token to a V3 token it regenerated the issued_at time and so the
regenerated token was considered to be after the revocation event.

Change-Id: I71fea3253295ee8794fb2c8211e1f030de3ae205
Closes-Bug: #1348820
'}, {'created': '2014-07-25 22:09:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for V2 token issued_at time changing

When the server converted a V2 token to a V3 token it regenerated
the issued_at time.

This was causing the server to return a different issued_at time
when a V2 token was validated using the V3 API.

This was causing the server to fail to revoke a V2 token if it was
revoked before validating it first because the regenerated token was
considered to be after the revocation event.

Change-Id: I71fea3253295ee8794fb2c8211e1f030de3ae205
Closes-Bug: #1348820
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for V2 token issued_at time changing

When the server converted a V2 token to a V3 token it regenerated
the issued_at time.

This was causing the server to return a different issued_at time
when a V2 token was validated using the V3 API.

This was causing the server to fail to revoke a V2 token if it was
revoked before validating it first because the regenerated token was
considered to be after the revocation event.

Change-Id: I71fea3253295ee8794fb2c8211e1f030de3ae205
Closes-Bug: #1348820

commit_message:
Add soft policies for server-group feature

This spec describes the need and a possible implementation
of soft-affinty and soft-anti-affinty policies

Change-Id: I66f7f5f089d7bd9d00478adf542a1f7bc0116602

[{'created': '2014-07-28 14:31:52.000000000', 'message': 'Sync log from oslo-incubator for isEnabledFor fix

Sync log.py to get commit:

726d00a Adjust oslo logging to provide adapter is enabled for

Which is needed to fix an issue with logging in flow_utils
when using python 2.6.

This also brings in dependencies.

Changes:

jsonutils
---------
ef37e03 Added missing jsonutils.dump() function

log
---
726d00a Adjust oslo logging to provide adapter is enabled for
433fa0b Make logging_context_format_string optional in log.set_defaults
ac92c06 Add default log level for websocket
5fd77eb Ability to customize default_log_levels for each project
4d9328c Python 3: enable tests/unit/test_log.py
cb5a804 Move `mask_password` to strutils
3310d8d update new requests logger to default WARN

strutils
--------
cb5a804 Move `mask_password` to strutils

Change-Id: Iea344e4bd3a612cd4110143e4fbb8e2fdfd88165
Closes-Bug: #1343544
'}]
commit_message:
Sync log from oslo-incubator for isEnabledFor fix

Sync log.py to get commit:

726d00a Adjust oslo logging to provide adapter is enabled for

Which is needed to fix an issue with logging in flow_utils
when using python 2.6.

This also brings in dependencies.

Changes:

jsonutils
---------
ef37e03 Added missing jsonutils.dump() function

log
---
726d00a Adjust oslo logging to provide adapter is enabled for
433fa0b Make logging_context_format_string optional in log.set_defaults
ac92c06 Add default log level for websocket
5fd77eb Ability to customize default_log_levels for each project
4d9328c Python 3: enable tests/unit/test_log.py
cb5a804 Move `mask_password` to strutils
3310d8d update new requests logger to default WARN

strutils
--------
cb5a804 Move `mask_password` to strutils

Change-Id: Iea344e4bd3a612cd4110143e4fbb8e2fdfd88165
Closes-Bug: #1343544

commit_message:
Refactor AWS::EC2::Instance delete handling

Refactor instance to use the nova_utils delete function.

Closes-Bug: #1329453
Change-Id: Ie84fb3c5c9f6381e4eea3a5e99d62266a8abd023

a few nits inline.

all the URL parsing being added looks like funcionality I would expect swiftclient to provide. Have you looked / checked with the swift team about that?

also, it would be good to see how this will be leveraged by a driver. Can it be added to the current PXE driver? If so, at least a WIP patch showing that would be helpful in assessing this patch.

Overall, there's nothing i can test here, but the direction looks good."}, {'account_id': 10380, 'date': '2014-04-09 20:28:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

deva: Can do on Security Impact. 

I checked swiftclient before writing this but there doesn't appear to be anything. I have it on my todo list to add it to swiftclient eventually, because I think it is very helpful. Swift itself includes a CLI tool called swift-temp-url here: https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/bin/swift-temp-url. I think it makes more sense in the client though.

It is currently leveraged in the agent driver (it is a key piece). Starting a line 105: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/84795/13/ironic/drivers/modules/agent.py. I could add a reference in the PXE driver, but I don't think there's as much use there, because the security concerns aren't as large as passing auth tokens to the agent."}, {'account_id': 10380, 'date': '2014-04-09 20:35:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2014-04-17 22:53:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The code LGTM. We also discussed this with notmyname today. Brief summary:

- he validated the use of tempurls to avoid passing a full keystone token
- unclear whether glance provides a mechanism to generate tempurls already
- implementation should take into consideration that signing keys are per-user, not per-cloud. it is probably sufficient to document that this key should be an admin-/operator-level swift key
- there may be performance issues with large numbers of parallel downloads of the same image direct from swift. several solutions were proposed. 


I am adding a -1 vote for the moment, pending three things:
- validation that glance does not provide tempurl-generation mechanism (or a change to this patch leveraging it)
- I would like to see the performance suggestions tracked somewhere, eg. in a blueprint or bug report.
- this patch should probably also have a DocImpact flag, since it is adding an integration point with Swift that did not previously exist. This will help folks to follow up with doc updates. (A separate patch to add to ironic/doc/source/deployer would be great!)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-04-21 17:49:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

I haven't received any response in the openstack-glance channel regarding swift temp urls, and greping around the glance source hasn't shown any support for temp urls yet. There are no outstanding bugs or blueprints that suggest support is coming.

I updated the commit message with the other points mentioned out by Devananda and added a todo to my list to add to the docs."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-04-21 18:31:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-18 22:44:20.000000000', 'message': 'Adding swift temp url support

This patch will allow properly configured Glance servers to return a temporary
URL for an object hosted on Swift. It will require Glance to use Swift
as its backend. A temporary URL will let the agent download an image from
Glance without requiring an auth_token, which gives access more than just
Glance. This is a security concern.

Change-Id: I10e4784eee63e8edc9ba30a9c5004a08aa3a6d8e

This patch will allow properly configured Glance servers to return a temporary
URL for an object hosted on Swift. It will require Glance to use Swift
as its backend. A temporary URL will let the agent download an image from
Glance without requiring an auth_token, which gives access more than just
Glance. The easiest way to use it is to enable direct_url in Glance, but
you can set the appropriate config options to avoid needing to enable it.

We/I need to add a note in the docs about Swift being a possible dependency
for Ironic deploys using IPA, along with how to set the Temp URL key.

Swift perfomance concerns will be addressed in this blueprint:

'}, {'created': '2014-06-18 13:28:49.000000000', 'message': 'Adding swift temp url support

This patch will allow properly configured Glance servers to return a temporary
URL for an object hosted on Swift. It will require Glance to use Swift
as its backend. A temporary URL will let the agent download an image from
Glance without requiring an auth_token, which gives access more than just
Glance. The easiest way to use it is to enable direct_url in Glance, but
you can set the appropriate config options to avoid needing to enable it.

We/I need to add a note in the docs about Swift being a possible dependency
for Ironic deploys using IPA, along with how to set the Temp URL key.

Swift perfomance concerns will be addressed in this blueprint:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/improve-swift-agent-downloads

This patch will allow properly configured Glance servers to return a temporary
URL for an object hosted on Swift. It will require Glance to use Swift
as its backend. A temporary URL allow a deploy driver to download an image
from Glance without requiring an auth_token, which gives access more than
just Glance. This requires a set of config options: the Glance endpoint URL,
a shared secret temporary key, and the account configured in Glance to talk
to Swift with, which owns the container images are stored in.

config options.

for Ironic deploys using IPA, along with how to set the Temp URL key.

commit_message:
Adding swift temp url support

This patch will allow properly configured Glance servers to return a temporary
URL for an object hosted on Swift. It will require Glance to use Swift
as its backend. A temporary URL allow a deploy driver to download an image
from Glance without requiring an auth_token, which gives access more than
just Glance. This requires a set of config options: the Glance endpoint URL,
a shared secret temporary key, and the account configured in Glance to talk
to Swift with, which owns the container images are stored in.

A later patch will explore using the direct_url in Glance to simplify the
config options.

We/I need to add a note in the docs about Swift being a possible dependency
for Ironic deploys using IPA, along with how to set the Temp URL key.

Swift performance concerns will be addressed in this blueprint:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/improve-swift-agent-downloads

SecurityImpact
DocImpact

Partial Implements: blueprint swift-temp-urls
Change-Id: I10e4784eee63e8edc9ba30a9c5004a08aa3a6d8e

[{'created': '2014-07-24 01:56:34.000000000', 'message': 'Sqlite files excluded from the repo

In order to avoid submission of sql database files by mistake, it was
added the pattern of those files into the .gitignore file.

Change-Id: Iaec6b15c8d879c42883de138fa70a2004ca9b2b5
Closes-Bug: #1347976
'}]
commit_message:
Sqlite files excluded from the repo

In order to avoid submission of sql database files by mistake, it was
added the pattern of those files into the .gitignore file.

Change-Id: Iaec6b15c8d879c42883de138fa70a2004ca9b2b5
Closes-Bug: #1347976

commit_message:
Cisco: Fix test cases which make incorrect create requests

Some test cases in the test_n1kv_plugin module are sending more than
one dictionary while creating the network profile resources. This
patch corrects these erroneous test cases while preserving the test
cases intended behavior.

Change-Id: I99de0b708218cf5217ecf47c74a30f75d0733e25
Closes-bug: #1347963

make running the update script easier (as it fails on mistralclient

commit_message:
Updated from global requirements

Note: I also just moved mistralclient to the bottom of the list to
make running the update script easier (as it fails on mistralclient
and stops).

cd ../requirements
python update.py ../solum

Change-Id: I29d954ef8980050a73f362718714565ee5af1da1

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-28 20:28:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ImportError during docs generation

nova/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/test_migrations.py has an
explicit import for lockfile but lockfile is missing from
requirements.txt

Change-Id: I8ae62e5235d0348b9fcc30ef6269089930858aa6
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ImportError during docs generation

nova/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/test_migrations.py has an
explicit import for lockfile but lockfile is missing from
requirements.txt

Change-Id: I8ae62e5235d0348b9fcc30ef6269089930858aa6

[{'created': '2014-06-19 23:44:05.000000000', 'message': "Allow metadata updates to provider resources

If the metadata of a provider resource changes, we shouldn't replace the
whole provider.

This is not a backport, because this has been fixed more generically for

Closes-Bug: #1332354

commit_message:
Allow metadata updates to provider resources

If the metadata of a provider resource changes, we shouldn't replace the
whole provider.

This is not a backport, because this has been fixed more generically for
all resources in master, where update_allowed_properties no longer
exists.

Change-Id: I706b3a2faeef582e906fe2195d79200ab3853a2c
Closes-Bug: #1332354

Some edits for help strings

Some edits for neutron help strings as noticed by Lana during review of
this patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/102900/

commit_message:
Add a tox job for generating docs

Add a tox job to make it easier for developers to generate their
own docs before submitting a patch.

Change-Id: I86dbfc64a9d174697048c254c6d3d042a62350b4

subject: Changed 'json' to 'JSON'

Okay, here's what I found:

The test calls get_disk_mapping in nova.virt.libvirt.blockinfo. For disk.config map, it calls get_next_disk_info with last_device = True.
the get_next_disk_info calls find_disk_dev_for_disk_bus, who calls get_dev_count_for_disk_bus. Now, this function get_dev_count_for_disk_bus check if disk_bus is ide, if so, it returns 4, otherwise, it returns 26.

in find_disk_dev_for_disk_bus if last_device is True, it returns a list with one single element:

if last_device:
        devs = [max_dev - 1]

Since on x86 it has ide, this returns 4 -1 = 3, in power, returns 26 -1 = 25

then, in the loop:

for idx in devs:
        disk_dev = dev_prefix + chr(ord('a') + idx)
        if not has_disk_dev(mapping, disk_dev):
            return disk_dev

disk_dev = dev_prefix + chr(ord('a') + idx)

the disk_dev in x86 will return hdd since idx will be 4, and in power, will return sdz since idx is 25"}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2014-07-16 16:23:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-16 16:23:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Inject expected results for IBM Power when testing bus devices

Same as in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/93621 this patch
inject expected values when the test is running on IBM Power
platform, since the ide bus isn't supported on IBM Power,
and libvirt translate all ide calls directly to scsi
when it's running in power platform

Change-Id: Ibebc96e71a8ba21ae8634e9e22de1cd28f3a7990

into node type.

commit_message:
Stub out rpc notifications in ec2 cloud unit tests

The ec2 cloud unit tests are running through the compute
manager and if something fails and is wrapped with the
wrap_exception decorator, we can get big ugly stack traces
in the log. We should be using the fake_notifier in these
tests like we do in the nova.tests.compute.test_compute
setup.

This also changes the test_ec2_validate test to use
local conductor like the other cloud tests that are going
through conductor.

Change-Id: I59bed0903aeef4086872c10d93a06f34b072dce3
Partial-Bug: #1348661

subject: Increase min required libvirt to 0.9.11

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-12-01 14:27:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

Please see bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1256406.
Do you think that there can or may be an issue with the libvirt version used in the gating?'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-12-02 08:20:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm not against moving the min version forwards, but there doesn't seem to have been any period in which users were warned that this was going to happen.  We have to give people following trunk some opportunity to upgrade their systems, and switching libvirt versions may not be trivial. 

What I'd like to see is a period with clear warnings in the logs that support for the version being used is being deprecated before the conditional code for versions before the proposed new minimum is removed.  

As with other parts of the system this should IMO be a full release cycle. So start the deprecation warnings now, but don't remove support until J."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-12-02 09:20:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@philday If there were major Linux distros out there which were still shipping & supporting older libvirt I might agree, but if you look at the distro support matrix the only one with libvirt less than 0.9.11 is Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. Anyone using that version of Ubuntu is going to be using their CloudArchive repository to give them access to OpenStack and newer libvirt + kvm packages. If you know of any other significant supported platforms which have old versions please add info about them so we know who to look out for.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LibvirtDistroSupportMatrix'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-12-02 15:49:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Daniel:

Kind of confused because the wiki page you pointed me to seems to say that libvirt 0.9.8 is supported on 12.04 - so how is it valid to move the min version forward to 0.9.11 in this case ? 

> Anyone using that version of Ubuntu is going to be using their CloudArchive repository to give them access to OpenStack and newer libvirt + kvm packages

That sounds like an assumption of user behaviour rather than policy or known facts.

My point is fairly simple here - there as been AFAIK no notification that support for 0.9.6 (the min version before this patch) is being deprecated - and I think something this  significant (esp as in the same patch you're killing of the compat code) needs to go though a formal deprecation cycle."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-12-02 16:05:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > Anyone using that version of Ubuntu is going to be using their CloudArchive repository to give them access to OpenStack and newer libvirt + kvm packages
> That sounds like an assumption of user behaviour rather than policy or known facts.

It isn't an unchecked assumption - it is based on direct feedback when I raised this question on the mailing list

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-November/019817.html

> My point is fairly simple here - there as been AFAIK no notification that support for 0.9.6

On the contrary, I sent mails to both developer & operators mailing list, and no one stepped forward to say they were still needing / wanting this old version of libvirt

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2013-November/003748.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-November/019767.html"}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-12-02 18:18:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Daniel,

Ok - I  missed all of those messages, sometimes the message volume is so high that stuff like this slips past me.  As you've probably guessed we do have a need for 0.9.6 support in Icehouse on Ubuntu 12.04 :-(   

On the slightly wider context isn't there some more formal process for deprecating support /features that goes beyond the mailing list - or am I thinking of something else ?

Cheers,
Phil"}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-12-02 18:57:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Correct (fat fingers) I meant to say we need 0.9.8.

I also wanted to add that we are of course looking to move on - but the timing of the change is what caught me out here. 

Phil'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-12-02 19:55:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

At the moment the gating is using 0.9.8. This is a concern - can we get this updated?'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-10 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-10 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-12-10 16:39:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Restored'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-10 16:39:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGit#Test_Failures

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-12-10 16:45:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-12-10 16:50:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> At the moment the gating is using 0.9.8. This is a concern - can we get this updated?

@garyk: where did you find that info - the Jenkins jobs pass on every upload so far, except for an unrelated failure in the first patch, which suggests the gate is using new enough libvirt already.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-12-10 16:53:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> On the slightly wider context isn't there some more formal process for deprecating support /features that goes beyond the mailing list - or am I thinking of something else ?

I've not found anything concrete on the matter. For python libraries OpenStack depends on we seem to increase the min required versions arbitrarily with no prior warning at all. There was a mail thread recently that suggested mailing openstack-operators mailing list on any user visible major change to people fair warning of a forthcoming change in the next release, which I did here.

If we need to have more rules on changing external software dependencies, then we likely need to discuss that more broadly than this review."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-12-10 17:09:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Answering my own question - the check-tempest-devstack-vm-full job at least shows the libvirt version in console.html log

2013-11-28 15:48:00.079 | 2013-11-28 15:48:00 Unpacking libvirt0 (from .../libvirt0_0.9.8-2ubuntu17.15_amd64.deb) ...

Now I'm curious why we didn't fail the 0.9.11 check in the tests"}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-12-10 17:11:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Work In Progress

Marking WIP until question of gate not having sufficient min version is resolved.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-10 17:25:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-12-10 18:06:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

FWIW, I think Daniel did everything right here.  The threads he started on mailing lists are the best due diligence we can do here.  This change is also being made earlier in the release cycle, giving even more time to adjust before the Icehouse release.

Phil, what would you like us to do to ease this transition for you?'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2014-01-29 17:51:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Sorry, lost track of this over the holidays.

Announcing the change early the cycle maximises the warning time for anyone moving from major release to major release, and they clearly then have until at least the next release to get ready for the change.

But for anyone following trunk they only have between the announcement and the change being merged in which to
react, and that's what's causing us the problem (we're still a month or more away from being able to make the switch)

It feels as if to be equally fair to both major-releasers and trunk-followers there should be the equivalent of a major-release worth's of warning in both cases.   The first post on this was just after the Havana release came out, so the earliest the change should be effective would in that case be early in Juno."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2014-01-29 18:05:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Gerrit comments are really not a good forum for this kind of debate. It is wider than just libvirt - eg Xen or VWmare drivers increase their min required version the same issues apply. Python modules  get their min versions increased all the time with zero warning at all, often with lots of pain for people.

This really highlights a gap in our procedures / policies for integration with external software components. I think that someone who cares about this issue needs to pick up the ball, write up a formal policy proposal wrt changing version deps on external components, take it to the mailing list for discussion and agreement by whoever needs to agree (Nova core / PTLs?).

I'll happily follow any formal procedure we clearly define + document, but I can't second guess what requirements people might have in the absence of any docs.

In any case, the intent to increase min versions will likely have to be postponed for now due to a bug we've uncovered which impacts openstack. https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=929412  So we will likely have to wait until Juno to increase the version & get the gate running on it."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2014-02-11 20:39:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm fine with the min version bump.

danpb: I think you can remove the get_host_cpu_for_guest function in the libvirt driver now right? Shouldn't we drop that in this patch too?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-02-11 20:39:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

commit_message:
Increase min required libvirt to 0.9.11

Increase the min required libvirt version to 0.9.11 since
we require that for libvirt-python from PyPI to build
successfully. Kill off the legacy CPU model configuration
and legacy OpenVSwitch setup code paths only required by
libvirt < 0.9.11

Closes-Bug: #1254727
DocImpact
Change-Id: Ibe8d2117e1246e4097d1bedeadcd6d99618f8400

commit_message:
Mark keystonemiddleware as being a universal wheel

Keystonemiddleware is pure python and is version agnostic. 
It should be marked as a universal wheel as it can be installed 
anywhere by pip (see the documentation on python packaging and
wheels). This mirrors python-keystoneclient's marking as a
universal wheel (as most of the code in keystonemiddleware
originated from python-keystoneclient).
 
Change-Id: I3e25578e6fc7a30b5eb7544d85a7ef39e711bd34

commit_message:
libvirt: driver tests use non-mocked BDMs

Ia99e04ad80a2823a6852debf0919e72b2f93bd26 introduces tests that
completely mock out the nova.virt.DriverBlockDevice classes. While this
is generally OK - it is more desirable to test the code with only
the furthest bits from the object/method under test mocked.

It was not practical to do it at the time due to __setattr__ behaviour
which is now changed - so let's fix this too.

Change-Id: I186e9c07aafb18b3d9010c5794bb7964f1ff0056

commit_message:
Use one name for neutron database after healing

Now that the Neutron database is healed we no longer need a
plugin-specific name for it.

Related Blueprint: db-migration-refactor

Change-Id: If25e77444f115817e5570bb447bde5b9c8d6e686

commit_message:
Revert "Add keystone v3 auth support"

This reverts commit a98c1f3617604c4871263ff9cc986b27f302ef46.
The new usage of session doesn't work with resources or events.

Conflicts:
	heatclient/tests/test_shell.py
Closes-Bug: #1349467

Change-Id: Ib5b0db81454abe647aca6461dd7bd5f197267fb8

commit_message:
Handle exception from pexpect child.close

When pexpect child.close(force=True) is called to close a sudo process, an
exception may be raised on certain operating systems. Terminating a sudo
process as a non-root user succeeds on Ubuntu 12.04 but fails on 14.04.

Handle this exception and try to kill the child process using 'sudo kill'.

See related change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/100353 that addresses
another instance of the same issue.

Change-Id: I4bd9e4b98479e33604545713337440ce81ca64ee
Partial-Bug: 1343344

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-17 17:43:30.000000000', 'message': "Handle volumes no longer existing in resume delete

init_host resumes deletes for volumes with a status of 'deleting'. It
does these sequentially, and sometimes a volume could be deleted under
it, causing a bad stacktrace. This will gracefully handle those
situations and move on. Added coverage for resume volume delete being
successful as well.

Change-Id: I5b30265609b65804f2da77d9daa84b640de7939c
Closes-Bug: #1322340
(cherry picked from commit b8a064f10a4dad097ef40f401015897cf9b424c3)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle volumes no longer existing in resume delete

init_host resumes deletes for volumes with a status of 'deleting'. It
does these sequentially, and sometimes a volume could be deleted under
it, causing a bad stacktrace. This will gracefully handle those
situations and move on. Added coverage for resume volume delete being
successful as well.

Change-Id: I5b30265609b65804f2da77d9daa84b640de7939c
Closes-Bug: #1322340
(cherry picked from commit b8a064f10a4dad097ef40f401015897cf9b424c3)

commit_message:
Cleanup

The resources were split between "Core API" and "Identity". All of
these are core APIs so the Identity grouping was removed.

Long lines of paragraph text were wrapped at 79 chars for easier
reviewing.

Change-Id: I423ef0ebd69e546f2dd8d7eac579a57ef591666e

commit_message:
Simplifying policy runtime to use single theories

Previously the policy runtime utilized a handful of special-purpose
interacting theories.  The intent was to explore a number of different options
for monitoring and enforcement.  But for our current focus on
simply monitoring, interacting theories is overly complex; moreover,
it makes it difficult to support multi-tenancy.

This change removes the interacting theories from the policy runtime.
Now every policy is isolated from every other policy. This also
makes multi-tenancy possible.  We've chosen to use the Nonrecursive
Theory as the default.  This avoids stale-state bugs likely
to appear in MaterializedViewTheory, which seems to be a
problem currently.

Change-Id: Idb6c08b9d2c52f2b28f16ed9d772df95404157aa

commit_message:
More logging for table_model

Previously we did not have enough logging info to properly debug
the table API model.

This change adds additional logging.

Change-Id: I1eebfa2f023d7f24264bd118dbcdd0523eec3671

I'm OK with this... this is seems like the right way to do it.   We should not let it tank the cage though.  The goal ultimately is that you should be able to dynamically load/reload DSE modules and if something is wrong with a module, we probably wouldn't want to tank a production environment.  This might be a good candidate for a command-line flag?  "-f:  halt on module or service load failure, otherwise just log a message and continue operation"'}, {'account_id': 8215, 'date': '2014-07-25 20:23:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Agreed that we should have a service manager that allows services to be installed, killed, restarted, etc.  This manager will need to inform the policy engine when a service goes offline so that the engine knows to treat the tables for that data service as if they are unknown, not just empty.  Doing this properly requires a non-trivial change to the policy engine, which is why we're just dying."}, {'account_id': 8215, 'date': '2014-07-25 20:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-25 20:27:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Made DSE raise exceptions instead of log

Previously, when DSE encountered an error when
loading a service, it simply logged the error.

This change raises an error that can be caught.

Currently such errors crash the system, but
in the future the system will respond gracefully
to data service failures.

Change-Id: Iedc66bd9b7e80b567a1012ba879479e5ab6e76f8

[{'created': '2014-07-21 22:35:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed bug with auto-generated tables

Sometimes the policy runtime creates new tables from existing table
names.  When it does so for a tablename that references an external
datasource, e.g. neutron:ports, it leaves the datasource prefix
in tact.  This causes the DSE incarnation of the policy engine
to try to create a data source with a non-existent data source
name.

This fix checks if the table-name is auto-generated before
trying to spin up a datasource service.

commit_message:
Fixed bug with auto-generated tables

Sometimes the policy runtime creates new tables from existing table
names.  When it does so for a tablename that references an external
datasource, e.g. neutron:ports, it leaves the datasource prefix
in tact.  This causes the DSE incarnation of the policy engine
to try to create a data source with a non-existent data source
name.

This fix checks if the table-name is auto-generated before
trying to spin up a datasource service.

Change-Id: Ic3995c888c74640f9b02a2acb986144b9cc536db

[{'created': '2014-07-24 19:12:47.000000000', 'message': "Deprecate partial field in v1.0, remove in v1.1

As of the Icehouse release, drivers are no longer allowed to enqueue a
subset of the messages submitted by the client; it's all or nothing.
Therefore, 'partial' is now always False in the v1.0 API, and the
field has been completely removed in v1.1.

Change-Id: I97a9e7e0dc047f44c7d6aab8913cdffb04a5b642
Partially-Implements: blueprint api-v1.1-response-document-changes
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate partial field in v1.0, remove in v1.1

As of the Icehouse release, drivers are no longer allowed to enqueue a
subset of the messages submitted by the client; it's all or nothing.
Therefore, 'partial' is now always False in the v1.0 API, and the
field has been completely removed in v1.1.

Change-Id: I97a9e7e0dc047f44c7d6aab8913cdffb04a5b642
Partially-Implements: blueprint api-v1.1-response-document-changes

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-21 22:35:36.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid redundant datasource tuple translation

Every time Neutron is queried for its
current information, the Neutron driver
converts that information to tuples, even
if the data is exactly the same as it was
previously.

This change only runs the conversion to
tuples when the data is different than
it was previously.  This has the benefit
that bug #1344475 has less impact
in the common case where data has not changed.

Related to bug 1344475

Change-Id: I53132258804eeff8020f07d46dc2515aa23ee368

that bug #1344475 has less impact
in the common case where data has not changed.

Change-Id: I53132258804eeff8020f07d46dc2515aa23ee368
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid redundant datasource tuple translation

Every time Neutron is queried for its
current information, the Neutron driver
converts that information to tuples, even
if the data is exactly the same as it was
previously.

This change only runs the conversion to
tuples when the data is different than
it was previously.  This has the benefit
that bug #1344475 has less impact
in the common case where data has not changed.

Related-bug: 1344462
Change-Id: I53132258804eeff8020f07d46dc2515aa23ee368

commit_message:
Eliminates redundant table rows at API level

This change fixes the bug at the API
layer where the policy engine returns multiple
copies of the same result.  It is a temporary
fix until we correct the underlying policy engine.

Related-bug: 1344466
Change-Id: Ia969e1052f5bc66b407b6626aad998281c59b0b0

commit_message:
Aggregated commit after VM failure

This change is the combination of 15 changesets
where the commit history was lost but the code was not
when a VM failed.

Bugs
o  policy rule IDs turned into strings instead of UUID objects
o  datasource driver no longer sleeps between polling since that
delays message handling as well
o  DSE prepush logic now properly aborts message send when
prepush_processor returns None

Features
o  more granular/unified/improved logging
o  Neutron driver now exports security groups, routers, and has
more robust port handling
o  Added policy_path to Congress server so it can load persisted
policies at startup

Change-Id: I3824d7dbacd09ecae86c47db7e3ceaf44aab4a85

commit_message:
Update draft-i18n-manuals.html

Add Catalan api-quick-start.
Add language codes everywhere for consistency.

Change-Id: I86ab7ea3a7bae458b3a88b93fcddd281e30dfd0f

(1 comment)

It seems that places where instance_info was used before have been changed to use the test config.

I get that instance_info is gross. It's a global variable. But the config values are too, and they aren't even a class. Hardcoding the expected result to be whatever the config file says the datastore should be for the initially created instance is worse, as it means a maintainer has to know the instance being used for a test was created by another test which also used that value. Using instance_info as the go-to source for what the expected values should be at least extracts this into a class- nevermind the fact we're only using a single instance of that class right now."}, {'account_id': 2559, 'date': '2014-07-23 21:38:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-23 21:38:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

commit_message:
Make configuration tests configurable by datastore

Adds flexibility to configuration tests to make used mysql configs
configurable.

Change-Id: Id7ef621c185af6514b87ec4f79001461bc3851c3
Closes-bug: 1334888

commit_message:
Remove strict checking of encryption type

The server may accept a different set of encryption-algorithm
dependending on the service plugin that is being used.  Without a
better mechanism for communicating this to the client, we decided at
the Atlanta summit to just remove it.

Change-Id: I658fe00281e9cbd018095969d80f5c09aca6cd38
Closes-Bug: #1322659

'}, {'created': '2014-07-08 20:12:31.000000000', 'message': 'Add a new timeout option to set the HTTP Timeout

Adds a new --timeout option and check to the env
var OS_TIMEOUT to set the HTTP timeout used for
the request to the Neutron backend.

commit_message:
Add a new timeout option to set the HTTP Timeout

Adds a new --timeout option and check to the env
var OS_NETWORK_TIMEOUT to set the HTTP timeout used
for the request to the Neutron backend.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1338932
Change-Id: I0d9687e671f68c4845af2439abfe581c6dcf020c

commit_message:
Fix for CLI message of agent disassociation

Modified the CLI output messages

Removed network %s to DHCP agent -> Removed network %s from DHCP agent
Removed Router %s to L3 agent -> Removed router %s from L3 agent

Change-Id: I2df928b5e2edecf1aaf5ee15f95e51a37872239a

[{'created': '2014-07-25 19:11:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix tox -e docs

Remove unneeded sections from setup.cfg so that 'tox -e docs' works
and the specs can be published on specs.openstack.org.

implements bp publish-specs

Change-Id: I0ae5021c70fdf13b60ca8c97107854636cbe2995
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tox -e docs

Remove unneeded sections from setup.cfg so that 'tox -e docs' works
and the specs can be published on specs.openstack.org.

implements bp publish-specs

Change-Id: I0ae5021c70fdf13b60ca8c97107854636cbe2995

Creating a server is a asynchronous command, make create_server wait for
the server to go to 'ACTIVE' state so we can run a check on the server
afterwards.

Change-Id: Iafc0fe95e8224b1a800bd52aade3eb6488948639
"}, {'created': '2014-07-25 17:23:49.000000000', 'message': "Make javelin2 create_server wait for server to boot

Creating a server is a asynchronous command, make create_server wait for
the server to go to 'ACTIVE' state so we can run a check on the server
afterwards.

This also helps address the issue where the server isn't in ACTIVE yet

Change-Id: Iafc0fe95e8224b1a800bd52aade3eb6488948639
"}]
commit_message:
Make javelin2 create_server wait for server to boot

Creating a server is a asynchronous command, make create_server wait for
the server to go to 'ACTIVE' state so we can run a check on the server
afterwards.

This also helps address the issue where the server isn't in ACTIVE yet
and grenade moves on and turns off nova-compute causing the server to go
to ERROR state.

Change-Id: Iafc0fe95e8224b1a800bd52aade3eb6488948639

commit_message:
Explain how image download works to compute nodes

This patch adds a new section to the cloud admin guide that explains
the various features that affect how an image is downloaded to a compute
node.

Change-Id: I2bc3bdacf58815584a538de1663fd1bdb2944b5c

client is OverQuota and raises NoMoreFixedIps if error from
neutron client is IpAddressGenerationFailure. If the error

commit_message:
Raise specific error of network IP allocation

Currently Nova raise "Neutron error: quota exceeded" when
neutron client state code is 409 in IP allocation without
caring about if the real error is over quota.

This fixes raises PortLimitExceeded if error from neutron
client is OverQuota and raises NoMoreFixedIps if error from
neutron client is IpAddressGenerationFailure. If the error
is neither of these two errors above, it reraises the original
exception from neutron client.

Change-Id: I0d1942587a359acccfca5298c2dcb4b21d971a42
Closes-Bug: 1331353

commit_message:
libvirt: add tests for _live_snapshot and _swap_volume methods

The _live_snapshot and _swap_volume methods do a non-trivial
sequence of libvirt API calls which should be validated in the
unit tests

Closes-bug: #1346327
Change-Id: I14bfa08f0dbb4eaa7c4f069f70c257ba7605989b

commit_message:
Make the error message of alarm-not-found clear

When creating a alarm combination with invalid project, ceilometer will
raise alarm-Not-Found error, even though the specified alarm ids are
existent. The error message is easily misleading.
This change gives a explicit presentation of this case.

Change-Id: Id189209ed4ccf27543f8dc628ca5f82eeeeeaa44
Closes-bug: #1320433

commit_message:
Smoothing awkward sentence structure around incident response

Made 'black list' one word
Changed tense to 'recommending strengthening of'

Change-Id: Ic323c357542ce4ee0d96f8a2b9592d378a0da5a6
Closes-Bug: #1342946

commit_message:
Improve help text for --size option

Update help text to indicate that --size may be a required parameter.

Change-Id: If1a40475a8d4a8e1c71c2c1e61a87bacb6e42e00
Closes-Bug: 1336807

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-25 16:35:21.000000000', 'message': "Make several ec2 API tests inherit from NoDBTestCase

There are several ec2 API test classes which aren't
using the database so we should have them inherit from
the NoDBTestCase base class.

Change-Id: I6c2fcca72c93d6528a40813652c0bb6d6783ee09

commit_message:
Make several ec2 API tests inherit from NoDBTestCase

There are several ec2 API test classes which aren't
using the database so we should have them inherit from
the NoDBTestCase base class.

Change-Id: I6c2fcca72c93d6528a40813652c0bb6d6783ee09

commit_message:
guestagent/volume: Remove not necessary sudo call

The sudo call here is not required because `tempfstab.name` is created
by trove user.

Closes-bug: 1347466
Change-Id: Id0d24ea495a6a7bfd4e1a4355a08b58b96ae8a25

[{'created': '2014-07-25 15:43:28.000000000', 'message': "Don't override the original notification message

We must not override the notification message.

This patch make the code clearer by not changing the message payload
during the loop over neutron ressources.

Change-Id: Ib3d1245555c9d5e080fc0979df874ee940bed29d
"}]
commit_message:
Don't override the original notification message

We must not override the notification message.

This patch make the code clearer by not changing the message payload
during the loop over neutron ressources.

Change-Id: Ib3d1245555c9d5e080fc0979df874ee940bed29d

commit_message:
Pass disk usage options when using --all

This commit allows the arguments --human-readable and --top to be
used with --all to customize the output of the disk usage portion.

There are no unit tests attached to this commit, I have created and
referenced bug #1344200 which shows there is a larger bug to address
to create several missing tests.

Change-Id: I46b8359533989efc3067971acaafec1d0cbc2b9f
Closes-Bug: #1344178
Related-Bug: #1344200

[{'created': '2014-07-14 22:56:51.000000000', 'message': "Do not expose Token IDs in debug output

It is only very slightly less of a security issue to expose
Token IDs in the logs than it is to expose password details. This
change obscures the Token ID in the debug output in all cases to
ensure that the ID is not presented in any of the logs that could
be read by a unprivileged source (e.g. lower priv log watchers,
centralized logging, etc).

The main use case is to ensure that it is possible to correlate a
token to the various requests made. In some cases this has shown
where a token has expired (tokens weren't properly refreshed).
This use case for debugging eliminates simple redaction of the
token id from the logs.

SHA1 is no longer allowed as a hashing mode for CMS token hashing.
This is because SHA1 is being used to obscure tokens in the
session object debug. This is done to  prevent the debug output
from being potentially exposing a valid token (PKI->sha1-short-id)
in some configurations of Keystone / auth_token middleware.

The raw data elements from the token (e.g. user, roles, expiration
etc) could be added into debug/trace level logging at a future time.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ifeca3056b8552d4b78845e97ddc25f00c49950de
"}, {'created': '2014-07-15 00:29:24.000000000', 'message': "Do not expose Token IDs in debug output

from being potentially exposing a valid token (PKI->sha1-short-id)
in some configurations of Keystone / auth_token middleware.

The raw data elements from the token (e.g. user, roles, expiration

Change-Id: Ifeca3056b8552d4b78845e97ddc25f00c49950de
"}]
commit_message:
Do not expose Token IDs in debug output

It is only very slightly less of a security issue to expose
Token IDs in the logs than it is to expose password details. This
change obscures the Token ID in the debug output in all cases to
ensure that the ID is not presented in any of the logs that could
be read by a unprivileged source (e.g. lower priv log watchers,
centralized logging, etc).

The main use case is to ensure that it is possible to correlate a
token to the various requests made. In some cases this has shown
where a token has expired (tokens weren't properly refreshed).
This use case for debugging eliminates simple redaction of the
token id from the logs.

SHA1 is no longer allowed as a hashing mode for CMS token hashing.
This is because SHA1 is being used to obscure tokens in the
session object debug. This is done to  prevent the debug output
from being potentially exposing a valid token (PKI->sha1-short-id)
in some configurations of Keystone / auth_token middleware.

The raw data elements from the token (e.g. user, roles, expiration
etc) could be added into debug/trace level logging at a future time.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ifeca3056b8552d4b78845e97ddc25f00c49950de

Do not delete existing migrations or change frozen file.'}, {'account_id': 6524, 'date': '2014-07-21 14:54:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Sayaji, unfortunately the deletion of migration scripts before the healing cannot work. Even though this appears to only affect the nuage plugin, the healed database contains all tables. So anyone using trunk after the healing will have these nuage tables in the database, even if they are not using the nuage plugin. So the fact that there are no deployments using the nuage plugin is regrettably not any help here.

You will need instead to create a new migration to undo the effects of the migrations that you no longer want. Sorry about that. Since the tables will be empty, this operation will be quick.'}, {'account_id': 7962, 'date': '2014-07-21 17:43:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Hi Jakub, Ann,
Frozen script was introduced in current release itself. What is the reason behind not changing them in the same release if required? revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-08 22:35:28.000000000', 'message': "Changes to remove the use of mapping tables from Nuage plugin

Nuage plugin maintains a mapping of Openstack and Nuage resources.
With this change Nuage VSD can itself maintain this mapping, so the
plugin doesn't have to store the information in the neutron DB.
This eliminates potential out of sync and upgrade issues
Closes Bug #1338853

Change-Id: I03b32a83d792c742962e0195383a622c1967ae4f

commit_message:
Changes to remove the use of mapping tables from Nuage plugin

Nuage plugin maintains a mapping of Openstack and Nuage resources.
With this change Nuage VSD can itself maintain this mapping, so the
plugin doesn't have to store the information in the neutron DB.
This eliminates potential out of sync and upgrade issues.

Closes-Bug: #1338853

Change-Id: I03b32a83d792c742962e0195383a622c1967ae4f

I'd like us to agree on a specification for how "tracing" should work at a cross-DB level.   the mysql /db2 implementations here are so different and I'd prefer if we can make them largely the same thing with some options to change behavior, and definitely we shouldnt need the cursor monkey patching unless we really need to see the trace way into the internals of the DBAPI itself, which doesnt seem to be the case.'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2014-07-12 15:37:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I based the DB2 implementation on the mysql implementation. Also, I didn't want to mess with the mysql implementation because I don't know how to use it. I assume I have to enable tracing in mysql to see the comments. This may be easier for a DB admin to use than having the traces in the logs like this DB2 trace. I'm not sure that mysql tracing even works as expected with the move to oslo.db.

I didn't think about switching to using a listener... I like that approach better."}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2014-07-14 09:41:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Can we abandon this in favor of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/106406/ ?'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2014-07-28 20:01:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Taken care of by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/106406/'}]

commit_message:
Add connection trace for DB2

There was no way to easily configure the connection trace for DB2
like there is for mysql. This adds support for connection tracing
for DB2.

Closes-Bug: #1274523
Change-Id: I681d3b0ac98b8c89413c22d4bbde03fd73b1dc6b

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-28 16:28:48.000000000', 'message': "Update test data to follow changes in keystoneclient 0.10.0

In keystoneclient 0.10.0, there are backward incompatible changes
that the constructor of v2.0 UserManager and TenantManager take
additional parameters. It breaks django-openstack-auth unit tests.
This commit updates keystone v2 test data to follow the changes
in keystoneclient and ensure the unit tests work.

Note that this fix is not compatible with keystoneclient 0.9.0.
It is a temporal situation until global requirements is updated.
The unit test is run using the latest version of python modules,
so it doesn't matter in the master branch. This situation needs
to be fixed until a new version release of django-openstack-auth.

Change-Id: I9398c705acab262e89d4801da84ccea188980d99
Closes-Bug: #1349485
"}, {'created': '2014-07-28 17:14:36.000000000', 'message': "Replace UserManager/TenantManager with None in tests

UserManager/TenantManager seems private classes in keystoneclient
and the interface was changed in keystoneclient 0.10.0.
django-openstack-auth tests actually don't need these managers,
so this commit makes test data not use these classes.

Change-Id: I9398c705acab262e89d4801da84ccea188980d99
Closes-Bug: #1349485
"}]
commit_message:
Replace UserManager/TenantManager with None in tests

UserManager/TenantManager seems private classes in keystoneclient
and the interface was changed in keystoneclient 0.10.0.
django-openstack-auth tests actually don't need these managers,
so this commit makes test data not use these classes.

Change-Id: I9398c705acab262e89d4801da84ccea188980d99
Closes-Bug: #1349485

commit_message:
Don't use SQLAlchemy 9 version < 0.9.7

Versions 0.9.2, 0.9.3 implement Table.kwargs attribute as immutable dict.
It prevents setting defined storage engine for created tables.

Versions 0.9.5 and 0.9.6 are not very good. We could use 0.9.4 though
but not sure if it's worth to explicitly mention it in requirements.

Issue with ummutable dict was discovered during testing of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/81334/ but issue doesn't occur at the
gate because of used SQLAlchemy version doesn't contain immutable dict.

Change-Id: I2703b2a21365a78fb2e9226680a6ef542b759b4f

The error handling code that gets connections reset if necessary

which ConnectionError inherits from. There are other types of

to cause the connection to reset, as well.

commit_message:
Update ensure()/reconnect() to catch MessagingError

The error handling code that gets connections reset if necessary
caught ConnectionError. It really needs to catch MessagingError,
which ConnectionError inherits from. There are other types of
MessagingErrors that may occur, such as InternalError, and they need
to cause the connection to reset, as well.

This fix has already been merged into oslo.messaging.

--

Cherry-picked from oslo-incubator 234f64d608266f43d8856ff98c89ceba6699d752
See also https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1086077

Closes-bug: #1303890
Change-Id: Ic5082b74a362ded8b35cbc75cf178fe6e0db62d0

[{'created': '2014-07-24 10:57:30.000000000', 'message': 'provide breathing room for service shutdown

Nova compute is actually running daemonized with libvirt, and it
takes a bit of time to shut down on the old side of grenade. Give

Change-Id: I5d8814a63d7bf1c8d2502c6e5e57ba91e5dee8cf

commit_message:
provide breathing room for service shutdown

Nova compute is actually running daemonized with libvirt, and it
takes a bit of time to shut down on the old side of grenade. Give
ourselves a 10 second quiece period for graceful shutdown.

Change-Id: I5d8814a63d7bf1c8d2502c6e5e57ba91e5dee8cf
Closes-Bug: #1285323

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-28 15:42:16.000000000', 'message': 'Remove --tmpdir from mktemp

This option is not portable and does not work on Darwin. The -t option
and the usage of a relative name implies anyway that $TMPDIR will be
used, on all mktemp versions.

Change-Id: I3abfc8606b37d6e2f8c5ff4dc6855a4558e8f7c9
'}]
commit_message:
Remove --tmpdir from mktemp

This option is not portable and does not work on Darwin. The -t option
and the usage of a relative name implies anyway that $TMPDIR will be
used, on all mktemp versions.

Change-Id: I3abfc8606b37d6e2f8c5ff4dc6855a4558e8f7c9

commit_message:
Fixing up repo for stable/icehouse branch

* Adding defaultbranch to .gitreview
* Removing Berksfile.lock from .gitreview
* Removing Gemfile.lock from .gitignore
* Adding updated Berksfile.lock file
* Adding updated Gemlock.lock file

Partial-Bug: 1349150
Change-Id: I7ad4a83b26d7e5845f0548e8c5004bce1ac2b417

makes code a little confused, because according to documetation

commit_message:
Reusing PARAMETER_CONSTRAINTS value

The variable PARAMETER_CONSTRAINTS is not used, also this variable
makes code a little confused, because according to documetation
constraints for parameters don't include MIN, MAX and CONSTRAINTS
definitions. This patch makes this definition clear.

Change-Id: I47b49e3ed23720ed652f688f2901ae9bc6b01632

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-24 16:24:08.000000000', 'message': 'Update oslo requirements to use juno dev versions

Update the versions for oslo.config, oslo.messaging, and oslo.rootwrap
so the releases under development are available for developers running
unit tests.

Change-Id: I9bdceb1a4f8ce81778b66fcacdfec58e23160519
'}]
commit_message:
Update oslo requirements to use juno dev versions

Update the versions for oslo.config, oslo.messaging, and oslo.rootwrap
so the releases under development are available for developers running
unit tests.

Change-Id: I9bdceb1a4f8ce81778b66fcacdfec58e23160519

[{'created': '2014-07-24 20:52:25.000000000', 'message': "TESTING: Trigger guru meditation report on nova-compute

commit_message:
TESTING: Trigger guru meditation report on nova-compute

For some reason nova-compute isn't dying, send SIGUSR1 to trigger
guru meditation for debugging.

send SIGUSR1 to nova-api to sanity check.

Change-Id: Ib225b4c1db52c9a0cd043b0781b17282e4bd7652

commit_message:
Data Processing: Fixing UI refresh for deleted clusters

An Http404 is now returned when an update request comes
in for a cluster that has been deleted which will trigger
the appropriate UI update (removal of that cluster).

Change-Id: I7216d361d3d09cb593b6ca2f3b89bfb9fc67917e
Closes-Bug:  bug #1336292
Co-Authored-By: Andrew Lazarev <alazarev@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
virt: switch order of args to assertEqual in guestfs test

Policy is to have the expected data first in an assertEqual
call, so update the guestfs test suite to match.

Change-Id: Ic0cbe354dde87881ebaec78bb2cb03a32edd36c5

commit_message:
Add decorator expected_errors for v3 attach_interfaces

All v3 api should use expected_errors to prevent unexpected exception
raised. This patch add decorator expected_errors for v3 attach_interfaces.

This patch also remove update action. Let the wsgi return HTTPNotFound for
it.

Change-Id: Icefe9f9adfa7ad01bc3ab11dcb7c132702390d04

subject: preserving dashboard order for update_dashboards call

commit_message:
preserving dashboard order for update_dashboards call

the call to update_dashboards() can rewrite the existing order
of dashboards, especially a simple plugin is writen to just
add a panel to an existing dashboard

Change-Id: I67a8c58f4b367262c2d6d0df9d78ec4a5d7b944b
Closes-bug: #1342999

[{'created': '2014-06-02 09:49:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix aggregator flush method

When no samples have been handled by the aggregator but flush method is
called, an empty array must be returned because 'initial_timestamp' have not been set yet.

Also, the pipeline always catchs exception from transformer and when an
error occurs into a transformer the unit can not catch them.
The patch also reraises any transformer exceptions.

Closes-bug: #1325507

Change-Id: Ib3183dfa3ee37ba586eb03a73f5de4641dd98514

commit_message:
Fix aggregator flush method

When no samples have been handled by the aggregator but flush method is
called, an empty array must be returned because 'initial_timestamp' have
not been set yet.

Also, the pipeline always catchs exception from transformer and when an
error occurs into a transformer the unit can not catch them.
The patch also reraises any transformer exceptions.

Closes-bug: #1325507
Co-Authored-By: Ala Rezmerita <ala.rezmerita@cloudwatt.com>

Change-Id: Ib3183dfa3ee37ba586eb03a73f5de4641dd98514

[{'created': '2014-07-08 20:17:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix glance endpoint tests

Glance endpoints are now located under http_client after reworking
for glance blueprint common-client-library-2. Change located in
glanceclient commit I5addc38eb2e2dd0be91b566fda7c0d81787ffa75

Test support both glanceclient versions for backward compatibility.

Change-Id: Idba3a05bdb09674b44dcc21c9427b4b85a29a1f7
(cherry picked from commit dac09ad2cd3a65efdd124b6001891428fff9811c)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix glance endpoint tests

Glance endpoints are now located under http_client after reworking
for glance blueprint common-client-library-2. Change located in
glanceclient commit I5addc38eb2e2dd0be91b566fda7c0d81787ffa75

Test support both glanceclient versions for backward compatibility.

Change-Id: Idba3a05bdb09674b44dcc21c9427b4b85a29a1f7
(cherry picked from commit dac09ad2cd3a65efdd124b6001891428fff9811c)
