- noop http://logs.openstack.org/75/98675/7/check/noop/e6d9b6b : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2014-06-17 08:26:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

@markmc: good idea, here's an alternative proposal for folks to consider as a counter-point:

  https://review.openstack.org/100445

Thanks,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2014-06-17 16:34:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

I like the way this is heading.  Inline I suggest that rather than having the TC report to the BoD, I think it should report to the ED (who, being an "Executive" can go cause things to happen).

Further, perhaps the resolution should simply say that the election officials should report potential violations directly to the ED.  I think that would avoid the TC conflict-of-interest mentioned earlier.  I would expect most Foundation CoC violations to go to the Foundation rather than the TC anyway.'}, {'account_id': 6316, 'date': '2014-06-17 17:05:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

"the Executive Director will have full discretionary power to execute the by-laws, policies, and directives of the Board of Directors of the Foundation" source: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Governance/Foundation/EDCandidateCommittee#AUTHORITY

Good idea, Jim.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-17 18:19:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 6316, 'date': '2014-06-17 18:19:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-17 18:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified+1

Build succeeded.

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/75/98675/8/check/noop/e3d1b92 : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 6316, 'date': '2014-06-17 18:24:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

I talked to Jonathan via spotty wifi.

He agrees with the spirit of having reports sent to the Executive Director. He of course would need to read the wording himself - which I would like - before he agreed with the resolution as it stands, in terms of supporting the Executive Director's portion of the process."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2014-06-17 20:47:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2014-06-19 11:20:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6316, 'date': '2014-06-23 03:21:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-23 03:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-23 03:21:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Verified+1

Build succeeded.

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/75/98675/9/check/noop/0436eba : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 6316, 'date': '2014-06-23 03:23:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

I communicated with Jonathan via email.

Jonathan Bryce is the Foundation Secretary. Jonathan agrees with the edit Thierry suggested, so I made the edit.'}, {'account_id': 6316, 'date': '2014-06-23 16:17:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Also noting a concern I have with this proposal, which is availability of the Executive Director and Secretary to be available within a 12 hour window should the need arise, Jonathan has said he would make contact information available to at least one election official during the election period (4 week duration, every 6 months).'}, {'account_id': 6316, 'date': '2014-06-23 16:41:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Correction to above comment:
"which is availability of the Executive Director *or* Secretary to be available"'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2014-06-24 20:01:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

Thanks for all your work on this Anita

My concern about this approach remains that making the immediate recourse if anyone raises concerns be "take it to the ED who will consider the case and consider Foundation membership termination" to be terribly extreme in any of the cases we've seen to date.

I'm also concerned that immediately turning to the ED in cases like this suggests the technical community isn't capable of policing itself. I would really only like to see the ED/Foundation involved in extreme cases.'}, {'account_id': 6316, 'date': '2014-06-24 20:07:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Sure Mark, I have no problem submitting my report to the person or body of the tc's choosing. I had suggested the chair, the ED was suggested, I went with that. If you have another suggest of where or to whom I should take my resultant report, I will make an edit with your suggestion."}, {'account_id': 6316, 'date': '2014-06-24 20:11:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

I should also state that personally if someone has been found in violation of election abuse policies, that person or persons should lose voting privileges. Losing foundation membership removes the right to vote, the right to stand for election and free summit passes. That person or persons can still contribute to OpenStack. There also is no provision in the bylaws for having one's membership re-instated probably because it has never come up. Should it come up however, the Board would have to make a decision about how a former foundation member could be reinstated."}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2014-06-24 21:06:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

I think this looks great.  I'm comfortable with the reporting section because I think it's just clarifying a process with minimal extra processing and interpretation.

Of course anyone can report a CoC violation to the Foundation.  And of course anyone should be able to report election irregularities to the election officials.  Unless we want to invest them with lots of extra new powers, I would normally simply expect them to report to the Foundation.

If we want to further revise any part of that, I think that's fine, but I believe that this approach is substantially what is needed."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-26 15:08:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: -Verified

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2014-06-26 15:08:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

I have a slight preference for this approach, which IMHO is just clarifying a process that already exists.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-26 15:08:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Verified+1

Build succeeded.

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/75/98675/9/check/noop/fdabe71 : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2014-07-28 09:26:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Superseded by https://review.openstack.org/106557'}]

commit_message:
Adds a resolution addressing expected election behaviour

The time has come for us to set out specific expectations around
election campaigning as well as the process for addressing
reports of abuse. This patch is a resolution that sets out
expectations and establishes a process election official(s)
can follow if they receive a report of abuse.

Change-Id: I00d342e6a871c3500613097c2e3fc3a502b03ddd

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-12 10:51:30.000000000', 'message': '2014-07-11 Election Activities

This draft represents a combination of the work done in two earlier
versions of the resolution ([anteaya][eglynn]) and notes from the
TC meeting on 8 July 2014 ([logs][markmc]).

This version adds details based on the background for each position,
so that readers who have not followed the discussion will have a
better understanding of why we are talking about these issues. It
also tries to provide a clear reporting structure and cover some
of the technicalities of who can administer the election while some
members of the TC are running.

It also focuses on resolving issues amicably and educating the
community, rather than publicizing faults in a way that may punish
someone harshly for a simple mistake. I think this is in keeping
with the "benefit of the doubt" attitude I sensed from the most
recent meeting.

[anteaya] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/98675
[eglynn] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/100445
[logs] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/tc/2014/tc.2014-07-08-20.02.log.html
[markmc] http://paste.openstack.org/raw/85709/

Change-Id: I2c3cab078b16311c174a122960f223577d6577bf

commit_message:
2014-07-11 Election Activities

This draft represents a combination of the work done in two earlier
versions of the resolution ([anteaya][eglynn]) and notes from the
TC meeting on 8 July 2014 ([logs][markmc]).

This version adds details based on the background for each position,
so that readers who have not followed the discussion will have a
better understanding of why we are talking about these issues. It
also tries to provide a clear reporting structure and cover some
of the technicalities of who can administer the election while some
members of the TC are running.

It also focuses on resolving issues amicably and educating the
community, rather than publicizing faults in a way that may punish
someone harshly for a simple mistake. I think this is in keeping
with the "benefit of the doubt" attitude I sensed from the most
recent meeting.

[anteaya] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/98675
[eglynn] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/100445
[logs] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/tc/2014/tc.2014-07-08-20.02.log.html
[markmc] http://paste.openstack.org/raw/85709/

Change-Id: I2c3cab078b16311c174a122960f223577d6577bf

commit_message:
Modify nova_network vlan provider

Set vlan_start option to be --vlan_start
instead of vlan

Change-Id: Ic65a6d5488938df5df544487dcfb8b29480645eb
Closes-bug: #1348664

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Add metadata option to Nova Create API Wrapper

The Nova Create API Wrapper doesn't pass through
the metadata variable, requring any dashboards
that spin up VMs with metadata to use the python
libraries directly.

Closes-Bug: 1347824

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2014-06-30 00:53:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Thanks for this patch, Chris

This patch is necessary/right for supporting metadata deletion as the commit message said.

At https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/objects/aggregate.py#L110 , metadata can be removed only if a value is None. In XML request case, we cannot send None so this deletion has not been worked even if applying this patch.

I think it is OK that XML case is out of scope from this patch, but need to consider it in the future with the situation XML is deprecated already.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-30 01:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

[{'created': '2014-06-27 06:56:02.000000000', 'message': 'Restore ability to delete aggregate metadata

Commit I2c778f2237ba5bd2aa8335a0eae80f3aad3e9157 tightened the
input validation for setting the metadata for an
aggregate. However it also also accidentally excluded sending
null as the metadata value which has previously allowed the
deletion of the metadata key rather than an update. This
changeset relaxes the input validation to allow deletion of
aggregate metadata again

Change-Id: I54b91c2d421243e7e7521f2352598f73a258b88a
Closes-Bug: 1334846

commit_message:
Restore ability to delete aggregate metadata

Commit I2c778f2237ba5bd2aa8335a0eae80f3aad3e9157 tightened the
input validation for setting the metadata for an
aggregate. However it also accidentally excluded sending
null as the metadata value which has previously allowed the
deletion of the metadata key rather than an update. This
changeset relaxes the input validation to allow deletion of
aggregate metadata again

Change-Id: I54b91c2d421243e7e7521f2352598f73a258b88a
Closes-Bug: 1334846

commit_message:
Add to debug snapshot results from /api/nodes

- added new class to execute new type of operations
- added tests checking created file with info from /api/nodes
- added new libs to requirements

Change-Id: I786a742442bbb6d276027c0e2a75213b36c2e7bf
Close-bug: #1332511

commit_message:
Set LC_ALL=C into dib-run-parts env

Force LC_ALL to C to allow printf to work independently
from the locale. Gives invalid number error if run in non-english
locale.

Port to dib-utils of: Ia68853505485fefbf0890313456e7edb6097666b
Change-Id: Ibbfa7a4a91dca72b16bb8fcb9602b71eccf54008

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-28 08:11:04.000000000', 'message': 'labs: preseed changes for Ubuntu 14.04

Ubuntu 14.04 LTS needs an additional localepurge option to cruise
through installation using preseed.

This patch adds the missing option. The Ubuntu 12.04 LTS does not need
the option but ignores it.

Change-Id: I18b9c4e4b19d22fc92c661731e10529e30740c56
'}]
commit_message:
labs: preseed changes for Ubuntu 14.04

Ubuntu 14.04 LTS needs an additional localepurge option to cruise
through installation using preseed.

This patch adds the missing option. The Ubuntu 12.04 LTS does not need
the option but ignores it.

Change-Id: I18b9c4e4b19d22fc92c661731e10529e30740c56

[{'created': '2014-07-28 08:28:25.000000000', 'message': "labs: don't track Vagrant ssh keys

This patch adds one directory to .gitignore: the directory where the
Vagrant insecure ssh keys are cached.

They are downloaded and stored automatically by osbash and should not be
added to the training-guides repo.

Change-Id: I6ab7407ca52cd589812cd2b2054a5981a51651ae
"}]
commit_message:
labs: don't track Vagrant ssh keys

This patch adds one directory to .gitignore: the directory where the
Vagrant insecure ssh keys are cached.

They are downloaded and stored automatically by osbash and should not be
added to the training-guides repo.

Change-Id: I6ab7407ca52cd589812cd2b2054a5981a51651ae

commit_message:
Data Processing: Making cluster template field required

The cluster_template field is now required in order to
create a cluster.  The user will now be prompted to choose
a cluster template if they forget to pick one.

Change-Id: If10029164aa69702da3c5255a29fdd6ddaaa3b8d
Closes-Bug: bug #1336300

commit_message:
Display host address on row update

The host colume of the database table is calculated from
the ip address and / or hostname of the instance.

Currently this is calculated when the table is first
populated but not re-calculated  when a row is updated

Re-factor the code to use the same calculation to
determine the instance host information during row
update

Change-Id: Ic7b5e14918ea9d3196e0b591a8e57ccf6c0a71f1
Closes-Bug: #1336823

commit_message:
Add signal_transport property

Specify NO_SIGNAL for signal_transport on the BlockStorage0Deployment
resource.  Otherwise, this resource remains CREATE_IN_PROGRESS forever.

Change-Id: I973d197245ed32612bde9209479e6ae3a443fc69

commit_message:
Add user_data_format

user_data_format must be set to SOFTWARE_CONFIG on instances of
OS::Nova::Server where there are deployments. Corrects the following
error:

ERROR: Resource BlockStorage0's property user_data_format should be set
to SOFTWARE_CONFIG since there are software deployments on it.

Change-Id: Iba29588374980098d71585ff1bf26ad914a6711c

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-25 11:22:54.000000000', 'message': 'Use cluster kernel_params if node kernel_params is not set

Current UX messes with kernel_params setter logic

If kernel_params is modified after node is added to cluster -
kernel_params on node wont be changed

After this fix cluster kernel params will be sended to
orchestrator if no specific params provided for node

Change-Id: Ic03aaf92942d9e7f3c568460aaa0bd5d83cdb51b

commit_message:
Use cluster kernel_params if node kernel_params is not set

Current UX messes with kernel_params setter logic

If kernel_params is modified after node is added to cluster -
kernel_params on node wont be changed

After this fix cluster kernel params will be sended to
orchestrator if no specific params provided for node

Change-Id: Ic03aaf92942d9e7f3c568460aaa0bd5d83cdb51b
Closes-Bug: #1341486

commit_message:
Reuse a cursor instead of a conn.execute for better performance

Basically the same thing as https://review.openstack.org/#/c/109694/
but over in the account backend.

Change-Id: I9255f3145818da3adafc16d3bcf159608a78fe51

commit_message:
Add decorator expected_errors to V3 servers core

All v3 api should use expected_errors to prevent unexpected exception
raised. This patch add decorator expected_errors for v3 servers core.

Change-Id: Ia1fa09d6cf68a65c85ac5fd2aff9b9202d76e7ca
Closes-Bug: #1343778

[{'account_id': 10780, 'date': '2014-06-06 08:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2014-06-06 08:44:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-06 08:44:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Starting check jobs.

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-06 08:44:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed issues with notifications for DHCPagent

dhcp-agent-network-add and dhcp-agent-network-remove did not
generate notifications. These notifications eventually do not
show in audit logs. It is fixed in add_network_to_dhcp_agent
and remove_network_from_dhcp_agent by introducing notify()
method calls.

Change-Id: Ia23b981b2fbe739d22ebaa7bb0975fb9e39f881b
Closes-Bug: 1317008
'}, {'created': '2014-07-17 14:49:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed audit notifications for dhcp-agent-network

dhcp-agent-network-add and dhcp-agent-network-remove do not
generate audit notifications which are used for security
compliance.
CRUD operations of core network resources are handled by
neutron/api/v2/base.py. In base.py, each of create(), update(),
delete() methods makes calls to oslo.messaging.Notifier.info()
to generate these notifications.
In the proposed fix, it is fixed in a similar fashion in
extensions/dhcpagentscheduler.py inside create() and delete()
methods by introducing info() method calls inside them.

Change-Id: Ia23b981b2fbe739d22ebaa7bb0975fb9e39f881b
Closes-Bug: 1317008
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed audit notifications for dhcp-agent-network

dhcp-agent-network-add and dhcp-agent-network-remove do not
generate audit notifications which are used for security
compliance.
CRUD operations of core network resources are handled by
neutron/api/v2/base.py. In base.py, each of create(), update(),
delete() methods makes calls to oslo.messaging.Notifier.info()
to generate these notifications.
In the proposed fix, it is fixed in a similar fashion in
extensions/dhcpagentscheduler.py inside create() and delete()
methods by introducing info() method calls inside them.

Change-Id: Ia23b981b2fbe739d22ebaa7bb0975fb9e39f881b
Closes-Bug: 1317008

subject: Modify volume backup for backup service per backend
messages:
[{'account_id': 6094, 'date': '2014-06-04 00:46:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-04 00:46:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-04 00:49:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded.

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/63/97663/1/check/noop/75918e4 : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 6491, 'date': '2014-06-04 05:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2014-06-04 17:20:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think aligning backup-manager and volume-manager is a good aim, I'll like to work towards quite the opposite - I'd like to be able to have one single cinder-backup instance on its own node able to serve a dozen backends."}, {'account_id': 6094, 'date': '2014-06-05 15:58:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Duncan: It defeats the purpose of having a service in the design if one backend service is handling a dozen backends. In all other processes like c-vol we have the opposite and we have different services for different backends. I will be uploading more issues with current design in another patch to the specs and also highlight the advantages with new proposed design.'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2014-06-05 16:25:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It is *entirely* the purpose of the design to scale the number of backup services independently of the number of backends, made very explicit by putting it in its own service. Otherwise we'd do the backup in the cinder-volume service.

Since cinder-backup tends to be CPU bound doing compression, you might want more of them than you have backends. You might want to put them on nodes that have a fat connection to swift, or a connection to a dedicated swift endpoint firewalled off from other nodes.

Scaling of cinder-backup independent of cinder-backup, with the ability for them to exist on different hardware if desired, was and is a goal. I am *strongly* opposed to tying them together without very clear goals, and there are no code tidiness goals that will convince me in the slightest.

I think tying them together will make extensibility and maintenance far, far worse, not better."}, {'account_id': 6094, 'date': '2014-06-05 22:01:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-05 22:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-05 22:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Build succeeded.

Build succeeded.

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/63/97663/4/check/noop/83d69c3 : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2014-06-06 13:31:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I'm still totally and utterly against the proposal of aligning volume managers and backup managers."}, {'account_id': 6094, 'date': '2014-07-28 06:32:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Modify volume backup for backup service per backend

This change is to modify cinder backup service
for improved scalability,extensibilty and better maintenance.

Change-Id: Id4f831b2e500855ec9bfbeff9f63f7e82dbba7df

commit_message:
Modify the index migration slightly for backport

If we choose to backport this fix, the migration should be catching
an operational error. Also add a log statement as requested by the
nova review.

Change-Id: Ib33b8711900db9dc2826a099ff3cc6adffc8babb
Partial-bug: 1348720

commit_message:
Correct misspelled variable name

In neutron/services/loadbalancer/drivers/embrane/driver.py,
"persistence" is wrote with an "a", not with an "e".
This patch fix this.

Change-Id: I8da0d6d28c188c73ed844a8a0c7a523dae713344

commit_message:
Add virtual media boot support in ramdisk element.

This change adds support in ramdisk element for recognising
boot from virtual media cdrom and read the parameters from
the configuration file in virtual media floppy.
Change-Id: I28ca888b4ead4905f7141b38ed4b9a3614d00d26
Closes-Bug: #1321564

(15 comments)

Hi Rohan, thanks for all the work you've put into this. I got confused with all your changes, and forgot what the goal was. So I took a look at the bug. I think this is key: "I suggest we remove IDs altogether from the helper methods. In places where an specific ID is needed in a test we can add it explicitly."

My suggestion is to try that. Ie, in test/db/utils.py, only return the id if it is specified in kw arg. Then we wouldn't need get_test_node_without_id(), and you wouldn't need to do some of the other manipulations. If we do it right, I don't think tests/objects/utils.py needs to be touched.

Some of my comments may not be relevant based on the above.'}, {'account_id': 6124, 'date': '2014-07-28 05:49:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Partially remove hard-coded ID's from testdata

* Remove IDs in get_test_<resource> where not required
* Add create_db_test_<resource> method to create unique db objects for
  tests
* Generate IDs from db instead.
* Avoids any primary key conflicts due to hard-coded resource IDs

Change-Id: Ifddcadb40ce03ebc9d90c6be46932dd7cae26a41
Closes-Bug: #1268589

Other client code, like neutron client are moving to use keystone client to get token, so that its debug log output will be consistent with keystone client. I am not preferring to use keystone client in nova client code now, but I am attempting to make a same behavior. So, the problem I have is that novaclient *already* has code that does exactly what you're doing, in the safe_header() method of novaclient.client.HTTPClient.  This method is called by http_log_req() in the same class, and is used for safely emitting header data in the example curl command emitted during debugging.  Your patch tries to do the same thing for the data payload, but uses an entirely different method of expressing the redaction.  I would prefer to see the static string '*** REDACTED ***' replaced by the same sort of algorithm that's used by safe_header(), e.g. a sha1 hash of the data.  This scheme was discussed on the -dev list, and as far as I know, all clients are converging on using it."}, {'account_id': 8574, 'date': '2014-07-17 07:43:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-17 07:43:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

This is getting closer to what I'd like to see.  I'd suggest pulling the _redact() in as a method to HTTPClient, like the safe_header() method (maybe make it safe_body()?  Or maybe it makes sense to keep it as an internal _redact() method…).  Note that that's a suggestion :)  However, I really want to see the SHA1 value emitted the same way that safe_header() currently does it; it's a minor formatting change, but the formatting used by safe_header() resulted from discussion among several devs as to the best scheme, and I think it makes sense to be consistent."}, {'account_id': 8574, 'date': '2014-07-20 17:42:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-20 17:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

commit_message:
Don't log sensitive auth data

This code change redacts the password in keystone request, and
also redact the token text in keystone response. The code still
makes REST call by itelf, instead of calling keystone client.

Closes-Bug: 1327019

Change-Id: Ib9c0610c1ef351a127364478721cf961c2a30125

Adds some minor formatting to application wizard

Adds some minor formatting to the field description section for when you
have an extra long field description, or a multiline description.

Implements: blueprint application-license-tab

commit_message:
Arch Design edits on General purpose chapter

Follow conventions, especially:
* Use variablelists where appropriate
* Fix usage of project names
* Add non-breaking space
* Fix capitalization

Also add proper links to other chapters/sections and the HA guide.

Change-Id: If95ca943d101929378891b0deaaeacdc61714fde

commit_message:
Fix stop-chunking

In some cases the stop-chunking directive contained an extra hyphen,
remove it so that the directive is effective.

Change-Id: I4972aea3e0c9ee8a85718b47ca5b93f1b68329b9

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-17 10:13:21.000000000', 'message': "Fix error status code for multinic

When passing bad body in a request, most APIs return BadRequest response.
However, multinic API doesn't do it.
This patch fixes the error status code and adds a unit test related to
this change.

This patch's idea most came from
following patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/107266/

Change-Id: If1ef2077a0e9823dfc04e4ef5a6dfb02daf1a8dc
"}]
commit_message:
Fix error status code for multinic

When passing bad body in a request, most APIs return BadRequest response.
However, multinic API doesn't do it.
This patch fixes the error status code and adds a unit test related to
this change.

This patch's idea most came from
following patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/107266/

Change-Id: If1ef2077a0e9823dfc04e4ef5a6dfb02daf1a8dc

commit_message:
Catch CannotResizeDisk exception when resize to zero disk

When old flavor's root_gb is not equal 0 and new flavor's root_gb is 0,
the resize() in nova.compute.api will raise CannotResizeDisk.

Move up the new_instance_type check before using.

Closes-Bug: #1340159

Change-Id: I4abf93530cf919af50a88d6049019fb745547257

commit_message:
Add a test case for DB schema comparison

Add a test case that allows to check if the DB schema obtained
by applying of migration scripts is equal to the one produced
from models definitions on MySQL and PostgreSQL.

Change-Id: I58e2cffd03396223c530d492cd18927c357b90e8

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2014-07-25 19:03:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow"}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2014-07-25 19:07:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Any reason this can't be combined with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/109785/

Seems like the same topic?"}, {'account_id': 8247, 'date': '2014-07-26 03:13:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

No big reason. Eric wanted it in a separated patch since both of them are not related. This got split from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/101412/. I can combine them if you think it is more appropriate.'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2014-07-26 14:08:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I'd argue they are related and the bug should simply be "remove unused settings" or something.  But that's fine, particularly if Eric asked you to do it this way I don't want to cause churn.

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2014-07-27 17:15:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Does it make sense to have a deprecation warning that advises to use rabbitmqadmin and then remove it next release? This commit assumes it's not being widely used, but we always assume something is being used after it's released. I want to get rid of this too, but I don't want to surprise ops after upgrade, even if it is mentioned in the release notes."}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2014-07-27 17:18:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Actually if the rpc module is already gone, I guess it doesn't really matter since this is now broken."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-27 17:19:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Verified

commit_message:
Remove cinder-clear-rabbit-queues

cinder-clear-rabbit-queues should be removed because it does not
appear to be widely used and there is no user documentation for
it. Also, RabbitMQ now includes a management plugin and CLI,
rabbitmqadmin, that allows you to delete queues and exchanges.
This script was also removed in nova as part of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/40355/.

DocImpact: The RabbitMQ management plugin ships with rabbitmqadmin.
It supports RabbitMQ version 2.8.x and above.
Closes-Bug: #1348859

Change-Id: I77bb54065280771e5cc64835af9c584626ecf8b8

[{'created': '2014-07-26 00:44:04.000000000', 'message': 'Remove reattach function in cinder-manage

The reattach function in cinder-manage depends on
db.instance_get, which is not available in cinder db.
db.instance_get is only available in nova db. Hence, the

commit_message:
Remove reattach function in cinder-manage

The reattach function in cinder-manage depends on
db.instance_get, which is not available in cinder db.
db.instance_get is only available in nova db. Hence, the
reattach function should be removed from cinder-manage.

Change-Id: If33bf2f281735bd530641c1e6d15e9645f38b4b4
Closes-Bug: #1167931

commit_message:
Avoid RequestURITooLong exception in metadata agent

Length of API port query is proportional to number of networks
and may exceed URI limit. The solution is to query ports by
given ip address only and then filter them by network_id.

Closes bug 1348097

Change-Id: I2a87d6b215df380b24dd5ebb24947e8729f3f6fb

[{'created': '2014-07-25 21:33:44.000000000', 'message': "Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but cinder unittests don't currently pass
with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Redundant setenvs for specific test envs are removed to prevent them
from overriding the PYTHONHASHSEED value.

Note this change will need to be backported to the stable branches to
keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

Change-Id: Ia55031528d082a1b11da6890447c5584e9e27551
"}]
commit_message:
Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but cinder unittests don't currently pass
with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Redundant setenvs for specific test envs are removed to prevent them
from overriding the PYTHONHASHSEED value.

Note this change will need to be backported to the stable branches to
keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

Change-Id: Ia55031528d082a1b11da6890447c5584e9e27551

commit_message:
Refactor selecting values from an attribute

Move the code to select particular keys/indices from an attribute value out
of the get_attr intrinsic functions and into the attributes module as a
separate function.

Change-Id: I16135159027cc52e8da74a4b5863fc8a8595d582

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-20 19:54:53.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "ovs-agent: Ensure integration bridge is created"

This reverts commit e5cdad90f97d3a54a493eca19e7a3ff643426de1.

TripleO's multi-node testing shows that this patch caused a failure to receive
tunnel updates, leading to the first node up to have no agent ports, the second
to have one agent port, the third to have 2 agent ports, etc. Needless to say,
this doesn't work all that well :)

Change-Id: Ie90dd4d113a404948dd5debad48065b7db48faa5
Closes-Bug: #1292105
(cherry picked from commit ccaad827b2bdcdcf4b538c5d5367f14cfc22c08f)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "ovs-agent: Ensure integration bridge is created"

This reverts commit e5cdad90f97d3a54a493eca19e7a3ff643426de1.

TripleO's multi-node testing shows that this patch caused a failure to receive
tunnel updates, leading to the first node up to have no agent ports, the second
to have one agent port, the third to have 2 agent ports, etc. Needless to say,
this doesn't work all that well :)

Change-Id: Ie90dd4d113a404948dd5debad48065b7db48faa5
Closes-Bug: #1292105
(cherry picked from commit ccaad827b2bdcdcf4b538c5d5367f14cfc22c08f)

commit_message:
Deprecate conductor_workers in nova::api

Since we now have a dedicated nova::conductor class, the
conductor_workers parameter in nova::api isn't at his right place.
This commit deprecate the conductor_workers parameter in profit of
workers param in nova::conductor ( see https://review.openstack.org/106656/ )

Change-Id: I767b5c143f12a0f518828287b33aedbfd2201e72

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-23 18:15:46.000000000', 'message': 'Teach PBR about envra versions (useful for rpms).

As being done for debian, start to teach PBR about how
to create a rpm compatible version that will correctly
work for packagers building rpms (this will avoid those
packagers having to determine this format themselves).

Change-Id: Iba8d08984670cd14d6a7b037232d8b6309bfad4f
'}]
commit_message:
Teach PBR about envra versions (useful for rpms).

As being done for debian, start to teach PBR about how
to create a rpm compatible version that will correctly
work for packagers building rpms (this will avoid those
packagers having to determine this format themselves).

Change-Id: Iba8d08984670cd14d6a7b037232d8b6309bfad4f

commit_message:
Remove configuration parameter Q_DHCP_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS

According to the comments in stack.sh the configuration parameter
Q_DHCP_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS should be removed during the Juno cycle.

Change-Id: I3b38ff57f00e93e6d9692f516291f7129584bc74

subject: Fix no handlers could be found issue

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2014-07-24 22:17:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I'm down with the fix you made to the LHN driver, that's great.  I haven't seen the issue on the migration test... but that's fine.  To be honest though, why are we even logging in the tests?  I don't think there's really a whole lot of value in it.  If we get in a situation where unit tests are failing then it's easy enough to put some temporary logging in there to debug if needed but in the context of unit tests IMO it's wasted overhead and doesn't really do anything for us.

In other words, could you just remove all of the logging in the test instead of just the one item, and obviously nix the import of logging etc.

We should probably consider why tests have LOG statements any way on a global level."}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2014-07-24 22:52:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-24 22:52:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Fix no handlers could be found issue

This patch fixes the error message during
unit tests for 2 issues.

1) test_migrations tries to LOG and exception before
setUp is called because of the method decorator.

2) the hp_lefthand_rest_proxy tries to LOG an exception
for a missing import.

Change-Id: I11d2c9320c0a216b5795207488b906795d27b1e0
Closes-Bug: #1341752

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-07 18:02:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed audit notifications for l3-agent-router ops

l3-agent-router-add and l3-agent-router-remove do not
generate audit notifications when notification_driver is
configured in neutron.conf file.
By specifying notification_driver in neutron.conf file, neutron
loads the configured drivers (defined in neutron/openstack/
common/notifier/) on which these notifications
can be sent.
CRUD operations of core network resources are
handled by neutron/api/v2/base.py. In base.py, each of
create(), update(), delete() methods makes calls to notify()
method defined in neutron/openstack/common/notifier/api.py
to generate these ".start" and ".end" notifications.
However, for special operations like adding or removing interface
to/from a router, these are taken care in db modules.
E.g., add_router_interface() and remove_router_interface()
methods inside ~neutron/db/l3_db.py.
In the proposed fix, it is fixed in a similar fashion inside
add_router_to_l3_agent() and remove_router_from_l3_agent()
methods by introducing notify() method calls inside them.

Change-Id: I1354e51e4af24eda128c042926765683018b320b
Closes-Bug: 1317000

commit_message:
Fixed audit notifications for l3-agent-router ops

l3-agent-router-add and l3-agent-router-remove do not
generate audit notifications which are used for security
compliance.
CRUD operations of core network resources are
handled by neutron/api/v2/base.py. In base.py, each of
create(), update(), delete() methods makes calls to
oslo.messaging.Notifier.info() to generate these notifications.
In the proposed fix, it is fixed in a similar fashion in
extensions/l3agentscheduler.py inside create() and delete()
methods by introducing info() method calls inside them.

Change-Id: I1354e51e4af24eda128c042926765683018b320b
Closes-Bug: 1317000

commit_message:
Refactor handling of exceptions in Resource actions

The code to set resource states and handle resulting exceptions (by
translating to ResourceException where appropriate) was duplicated in three
different places. This change consolidates these into a single context
manager.

Change-Id: I3994c7cb73300c4b13437a4b37cd12f5b0a20b35

commit_message:
Adjust oslo logging to provide adapter is enabled for

In python 2.6 the isEnabledFor adapter method is not found
since it was added in 2.7+ so to enable its usage in openstack
which can want to use this method add it on when in python 2.6
and just call the parent method on other versions.

Closes-Bug: #1343544

Change-Id: I5c3ba91cb1a8555d649fffc1377e9e9dfe92fea8

commit_message:
Remove configuration parameter EXTRA_OPTS

According to the comments in stack.sh the configuration parameter
EXTRA_OPTS should be removed during the Juno cycle.

Change-Id: Ic71d38d6f9b8a8949e45ce3321d593ee2f8feb40

commit_message:
Add tempest tests to run in devstack gate

Added tests for secret create (single and two-phase), order
create, and versioning to run in the devstack gate.
These should both provide a base for additional tempest-based
tests and also ensure that future CRs won't regress basic
Barbican functionality.

Added skip to version tests until blueprint fix-version-api
has been implemented.

Change-Id: Ib1d6bb3a2251c21b9d7d647687d0ac30ad52e4c9

commit_message:
Merge duplicate code for network quotas tests

There is some duplicate code between test_quotas and test_lbaas_quotas.
To clearify the difference between them and the purpose, this patch merges
most code of them into a single internal method.

Change-Id: I05a9c92d052ea2f99694a588c2a3cebbde625166

[{'created': '2014-07-18 13:32:22.000000000', 'message': 'Skip migrate server invalid state if resize is off

The migrate (aka cold migration) can be considered a special case of the
resize with a flavor_id equals to None. For that reason to perform
the migrate tests we need to be sure that the resize is enabled.
This patch adds a skip decorators to verify that.

Change-Id: I3a02b1bd210e3934dfd61d4182b301cc33d8a962
'}]
commit_message:
Skip migrate server invalid state if resize is off

The migrate (aka cold migration) can be considered a special case of the
resize with a flavor_id equals to None. For that reason to perform
the migrate tests we need to be sure that the resize is enabled.
This patch adds a skip decorators to verify that.

Change-Id: I3a02b1bd210e3934dfd61d4182b301cc33d8a962

Remove unused cell_scheduler_method

This key isn't used anywhere in the code (it's use was removed a while ago).

Change-Id: Icf215b5dd0c7b93b336b6bb030f3a9282a0b05bd

commit_message:
object-ify availability_zones

This change converts availability_zones to use the Aggregate and
Service objects instead of direct database access.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: I2ec7373f063ed728dde2af3b7c8259f4391885bc

commit_message:
Fix error status code for agents

When passing bad body in a request, most APIs return BadRequest response.
However, agents API doesn't do it.
This patch fixes the error status code and adds a unit test related to
this change.

This patch's idea most came from
Ken'ichi Ohmichi's patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/107266/

Change-Id: I9602183ade4d3c0105e2498aebb7e33eb72f86f0

subject: Empty RecordSets can be re-provisioned

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 741, 'date': '2014-07-22 21:17:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hey Darshan - So, this actually raises an interesting question.

In the V2 API, I believe the current behavior is correct + expected, while in the V1 API, the current behavior is broken.

I think this means the change has to only be in the V1 API code, rather than in central where it will affect both APIs - likely in the delete record API call.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-22 21:30:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

An empty recordset is just a logical entity with a given record type.
Right now we save the recordset name and type even when it is a null set,
thus preventing us from re-using the name as a different type (eg. A to
CNAME). It would be better to check for this empty recordset condition
and re-provision if possible, rather than throwing error 400.

commit_message:
Empty RecordSets can be re-provisioned

An empty recordset is just a logical entity with a given record type.
Right now we save the recordset name and type even when it is a null set,
thus preventing us from re-using the name as a different type (eg. A to
CNAME). It would be better to check for this empty recordset condition
and delete if possible, rather than throwing error 400.
This commit also adds CNAME type to Record and RecordSet fixtures
Closes-Bug: #1304088

Change-Id: I4dd0e7def848939d8f0053a5ca40b14a0b68b8b3

commit_message:
Move loadbalancer vip port creation outside of transaction

Currently _create_port_for_vip calls ml2 create_port() method
which includes rpc notification.
That leads to lock wait timeouts in certain cases.

The patch fixes that while making VIP creation process non-atomic.
But that is fine as long until create_vip() returns vip id, it's
not usable from API.

Change-Id: Ie30973de80118a6b022e8c3bb07ca48122ebcd29
Partial-Bug: #1334226

commit_message:
Cleanup for Horizon fields

Since 'True' is the default value for 'required',
additional assignments are not needed.

Change-Id: I11ae029949e6245af1cf8b0c83825a2ed384aec4

Adds context tracking decorators that were missing
from router interface methods. Without them, new
sessions were being created instead of using the
existing context which was causing transaction
issues.

Modifies the servermanager to store context references
as weakrefs so if multiple functions are called before
the rest functions are called, the first one doesn't steal

commit_message:
BSN: Remove db lock and add missing contexts

Adds context tracking decorators that were missing
from router interface methods. Without them, new
sessions were being created instead of using the
existing context which was causing transaction
issues.

Modifies the servermanager to store context references
as weakrefs so if multiple functions are called before
the rest functions are called, the first one doesn't steal
the only context reference with a pop() call.

Removes a DB lock for update in the server manager that occured
during rest calls that was triggering deadlocks due to the
file lock synchronization for the rest calls.

Closes-Bug: #1336251
Change-Id: Iad3d61e2c23832b3ad760a999fbab7feaa13f805
(cherry picked from commit ee9fe2458f813b5d367bc7263c7a30a3af46aa2b)

commit_message:
Add index for reservations on (deleted, expire)

the query for expire_reservations currently does a full table scan.
This adds an index so frequent invocations of expire does not bog
down the database.

Change-Id: Ic6f6e4262746753d869ad37b8aaaa5ffc1c4efef
Resolves-bug: 1348720

commit_message:
Big Switch: Remove consistency hash on full sync

Clears the consistency hash before performing a full
backend synchronization. Since all of the data is being
replaced, there is no reason to include this and it
currently requires special-casing to handle.

Closes-Bug: #1328233
Change-Id: Iace766d869dc78b041d3a5464e728b872c8347c2
(cherry picked from commit e60670e5a202870693f7485a1da4411f4faaf36d)

Adds a new class to hold an SQL table lock throughout
a REST call to prevent servers in an HA deployment from
using a stale consistency hash value.

Also passes the current context down to the server manager
for every request since the consistency hash will need to
be read from the database instead of from a variable on the

	neutron/plugins/bigswitch/plugin.py
	neutron/tests/unit/bigswitch/test_servermanager.py

Change-Id: I5f8402c076d7732742c0ae4d9b9d6833d42a0b7b

commit_message:
Big Switch: Lock consistency table for REST calls

Adds a new class to hold an SQL table lock throughout
a REST call to prevent servers in an HA deployment from
using a stale consistency hash value.

Also passes the current context down to the server manager
for every request since the consistency hash will need to
be read from the database instead of from a variable on the
server pool object.

Conflicts:

	neutron/plugins/bigswitch/plugin.py
	neutron/tests/unit/bigswitch/test_servermanager.py

Closes-Bug: #1328331
Change-Id: I5f8402c076d7732742c0ae4d9b9d6833d42a0b7b
(cherry picked from commit 09e706b210513968cac2bad78fe81ee9cbb5b5be)

commit_message:
Add -s option for neutron metering rules

While adding iptables rule, cidr is added as destination for both ingress
and egress directions. Modified code to add -s for egress and -d for ingress.

Closes-bug: 1310589

Conflicts:
        neutron/tests/unit/services/metering/drivers/test_iptables_driver.py

Change-Id: Id9ca10855e6527d4bec689f8f9bcd6f681221954
(cherry-picked from commit 72e8b5dc5a5e36722327efca4c399f0321e9bbbb)

commit_message:
Add more columns to image list output

Add disk_format, container_format, size and status to image list
command. Added tests as well.

Change-Id: I8e3822c6d46d0020fc706955c026549f6c635587
Closes-Bug: #1348475

[{'created': '2014-07-19 16:56:00.000000000', 'message': "Don't leave snapshots on the floor

The current cloning process in the LVM
driver uses a snapshot to do the data
copy in the background.  Trouble here
is that if the creation or activation
of the new volume fails, we don't
cleanup the snapshot we created.

Just move the create_volume and activate
calls down into the try block so the finally
clause can do the cleanup for us.

Change-Id: If0fbab9d9f39102cdc7d287527be22c4a2b35934
Closes-Bug: #1312718
(cherry picked from commit 38ed0523125efeaf8383b36d1db169b42e2f5eb6)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't leave snapshots on the floor

The current cloning process in the LVM
driver uses a snapshot to do the data
copy in the background.  Trouble here
is that if the creation or activation
of the new volume fails, we don't
cleanup the snapshot we created.

Just move the create_volume and activate
calls down into the try block so the finally
clause can do the cleanup for us.

Change-Id: If0fbab9d9f39102cdc7d287527be22c4a2b35934
Closes-Bug: #1312718
(cherry picked from commit 38ed0523125efeaf8383b36d1db169b42e2f5eb6)

commit_message:
Fix security group modal header overflow

If you go to Edit Instance > Security Group
The two headers "All Security Groups" and "Instance Security Groups"
overflow when translated

Change-Id: I5acd0e4670a6595e6f38ba7f17371b6329ed5836
Closes-Bug:#1288402

Cleanup for Sahara fields

Since 'True' is the default value for 'required',
additional assignments are not needed.

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-14 23:46:12.000000000', 'message': 'Add requests-mock package to global requirements

requests-mock is a mocking layer for the requests package. It is
Apache-2 licensed.

The httpretty library has been used to provide a mocking layer for HTTP
requests. This has generally been successful however there have been a
number of problems with it over our usage, including poor python 3
support and a number of backwards incompatible releases from the
maintainer. It is also difficult to package by distributions.

httpretty was particularly chosen because it was compatible with both
httplib and requests, this is no longer such a requirement as almost all
OpenStack libraries have now moved to requests. Given that we can move
to a library with less complexity and more inline with OpenStack tools.

It is written in such a way that it is fairly simple to convert existing
httpretty test suites or httmock test suites to requests-mock.

I am the author of requests-mock and am also happy to move it to
stackforge, or otherwise connect it to gerrit so as we will not have any
future incompatible issues.

More info:
 - https://github.com/jamielennox/requests-mock
 - http://requests-mock.readthedocs.org/en/latest/

This would ideally not need to be in the icehouse branch however grenade
and other gate tests all run with the most current client release and so
require that the dependencies of the client match what is in the
requirements.

Change-Id: I09f2a22f84752571a278e9b90901ecb1fbedb654
(cherry picked from commit a0af4fa611016903f28b4032a16ba21063a0d4d5)

commit_message:
Add requests-mock package to global requirements

requests-mock is a mocking layer for the requests package. It is
Apache-2 licensed.

The httpretty library has been used to provide a mocking layer for HTTP
requests. This has generally been successful however there have been a
number of problems with it over our usage, including poor python 3
support and a number of backwards incompatible releases from the
maintainer. It is also difficult to package by distributions.

httpretty was particularly chosen because it was compatible with both
httplib and requests, this is no longer such a requirement as almost all
OpenStack libraries have now moved to requests. Given that we can move
to a library with less complexity and more inline with OpenStack tools.

It is written in such a way that it is fairly simple to convert existing
httpretty test suites or httmock test suites to requests-mock.

I am the author of requests-mock and am also happy to move it to
stackforge, or otherwise connect it to gerrit so as we will not have any
future incompatible issues.

More info:
 - https://github.com/jamielennox/requests-mock
 - http://requests-mock.readthedocs.org/en/latest/

This would ideally not need to be in the icehouse branch however grenade
and other gate tests all run with the most current client release and so
require that the dependencies of the client match what is in the
requirements.

Change-Id: I09f2a22f84752571a278e9b90901ecb1fbedb654
(cherry picked from commit a0af4fa611016903f28b4032a16ba21063a0d4d5)

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but neutron unittests don't currently pass
with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

commit_message:
Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but neutron unittests don't currently pass
with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Note this change will need to be backported to the stable branches to
keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

Change-Id: If151efeb8caae3111515191e238d6e6ae491cd44

[{'created': '2014-07-25 20:39:20.000000000', 'message': "Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but neutron unittests don't currently pass
with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Change-Id: If151efeb8caae3111515191e238d6e6ae491cd44
"}]
commit_message:
Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but neutron unittests don't currently pass
with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Note this change will need to be backported to the stable branches to
keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

Change-Id: If151efeb8caae3111515191e238d6e6ae491cd44

commit_message:
Update developer docs template

The current developer docs template used by ceilometer client is
not the latest template used by the rest of the openstack projects.
This patch will update the docs to provide a more consistent look
and feel when using project docs.

Change-Id: Ic25324da75100c0efe3e814de13807740592d4a1

commit_message:
Pass timeout parameter to requests lib call

Pass the timeout paramter set from the httpclient
init method to the request library so it has an effect.

Closes-Bug: #1338910
Change-Id: Icc818bffe5ca4fb141c976dcea6b44d947b69784

commit_message:
Ensure that session is rolled back on bulk creates

During bulk creates, the session is began explicitely;
ensure that it gets rolled back before re-raising in
order to avoid triggering InvalidRequestError
exceptions when the session is reused.

Partial-bug: 1244757

Change-Id: I797faeec2ca5374620db905599ab6e6f04fdcabd
(cherry picked from commit cb3f86dd781587eaa9fca6cc4a2f98de93526db7)

commit_message:
Move SERVICE_PROTOCOL from stack.sh to stackrc

This ensures that SERVICE_PROTOCOL is available to other consumers
of the devstack environment like grenade.

Change-Id: I702d7d239e50dd1446d55c076c7a7c57768486ff
Closes-Bug: 1335953

commit_message:
Fix exercises for Trove

Reasons:
 - trove.sh should use native python client to exercise Trove API

Changes:
 - adding datastore and datastore version exercises

Change-Id: I041465e5bda6ad9ec3f597ecc290612b8baef09c
Closes-Bug: #1346743

Partial backport of I8008837d2fae6cebeeeb051b63066279ca477e01

In order to make grenade easier to run outside of the gate make sure tox

commit_message:
Make sure tox is installed when setting up tempest

Partial backport of I8008837d2fae6cebeeeb051b63066279ca477e01

In order to make grenade easier to run outside of the gate make sure tox
is installed when tempest is set up. Currently one has to install tox
manually to get grenade to work.

Change-Id: Ie20de0c523cf1c31683fe69fa88f73705bed06b9

Remove configuration parameter Q_SRV_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS

commit_message:
auth tests should not require admin token

Currently all the v3 auth tests are calling self.post(), which
eventually going through keystone.tests.test_v3.v3_request().
The v3_request method always requires an auth token by default.
But since V3 auth token API is an unprotected API, there's no need
for an auth token in order to make the request.

Change-Id: If65305346c0e5e114fd03e4ba089aa2e3694a8b2
Closes-bug: #1317261

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Added check for DB2 deadlock error

Currently, deadlock is only checked for in mysql and postgresql.
This adds a check for db2 deadlock

Fixes bug #1340793

Change-Id: Icef725ed75929ff13234ea58026e6bf0f2e2c852

commit_message:
Fix stop-chunking

In some cases the stop-chunking directive contained an extra hyphen,
remove it so that the directive is effective.

Change-Id: Ibaa7901ff48f843c3051cdeb828a6ae463fe3c01
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <aj@suse.de>

commit_message:
Added lbaas-haproxy-cfg-rework.rst

Currently the LBaaS HaProxy config module only writes the config to the local
filesystem of the process.  In order to support other HaProxy drivers that will
have HaProxy instances running on other machines, the config should be turned
into an object and have the ability to return a string representation of that
object.

Change-Id: Id818082dd8f9570e9a5e3c6456410318134a13b9

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

[{'created': '2014-07-23 13:17:13.000000000', 'message': "Do not mark device as processed if it wasn't

Currently treat_devices_added_or_updated in the OVS agent skips
processing devices which disappeared from the integration bridge
during the agent loop.
This is fine, however the agent should not mark these devices as
processed. Otherwise they won't be processed, should they appear
again on the bridge.

This patch ensures these devices are not added to the current
device set.

The patch also changes treat_devices_added_or_updated. The
function now will return the list of skipped devices and not
anymore a flag signalling whether a resync is required.
With the current logic a resync would be required if retrieval
of device details fails. With this change, the function
treat_devices_added_or_updated will raise in this case and the
exception will be handled in process_network_ports.

For the sake of consistency, this patch also updates the
similar function treat_ancillary_devices_added in order to
use the same logic.

Finally, this patch amends an innaccurate related comment.

Closes-Bug: #1329546

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py

Required changes:
- fetch all device details first before proceeding with handling ports
  to reflect Juno behaviour.
- unit test was modified to run with get_device_details since
  get_devices_details_list is not available in Icehouse.

Change-Id: Icc744f32494c7a76004ff161536316924594fbdb
(cherry picked from commit 90fedbe44ca6bfccce5d71465532fbdc85ee3814)

commit_message:
Do not mark device as processed if it wasn't

Currently treat_devices_added_or_updated in the OVS agent skips
processing devices which disappeared from the integration bridge
during the agent loop.
This is fine, however the agent should not mark these devices as
processed. Otherwise they won't be processed, should they appear
again on the bridge.

This patch ensures these devices are not added to the current
device set.

The patch also changes treat_devices_added_or_updated. The
function now will return the list of skipped devices and not
anymore a flag signalling whether a resync is required.
With the current logic a resync would be required if retrieval
of device details fails. With this change, the function
treat_devices_added_or_updated will raise in this case and the
exception will be handled in process_network_ports.

For the sake of consistency, this patch also updates the
similar function treat_ancillary_devices_added in order to
use the same logic.

Finally, this patch amends an innaccurate related comment.

Closes-Bug: #1329546

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py

Required changes:
- fetch all device details first before proceeding with handling ports
  to reflect Juno behaviour.
- unit test was modified to run with get_device_details since
  get_devices_details_list is not available in Icehouse.
- fixed E128 violation in the backported code.

Change-Id: Icc744f32494c7a76004ff161536316924594fbdb
(cherry picked from commit 90fedbe44ca6bfccce5d71465532fbdc85ee3814)

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but neutron unittests don't currently pass
with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

commit_message:
Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but neutron unittests don't currently pass
with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Note this change will need to be backported to the stable branches to
keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

Change-Id: If151efeb8caae3111515191e238d6e6ae491cd44

commit_message:
Update oslo.messaging to 1.4.0.0a2 for Neutron

This was updated in global-requirements.txt, but for some
reason, no bot pushed this to Neutron's requirements.txt.
Manually updated the file to match global-requirements.

Change-Id: Idebf99df3a742daed636ffc31c71e9b983c48c43

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-25 21:31:47.000000000', 'message': "Add conntrack-tools to nova dependencies

'Error deleting conntrack entries' appears in all
n-net. Adding conntrack-tools/conntrack as nova dependency,
in order to eliminate this issue.

This is needed to fix this issue in the grenade case.

Change-Id: Ief9deeb3349a07e22fb365e58f3368c847f845ef
(cherry picked from commit 40f4438f9baa945e451f8a9fc682efe3fdf9b8f7)
"}]
commit_message:
Add conntrack-tools to nova dependencies

'Error deleting conntrack entries' appears in all
n-net. Adding conntrack-tools/conntrack as nova dependency,
in order to eliminate this issue.

This is needed to fix this issue in the grenade case.

Change-Id: Ief9deeb3349a07e22fb365e58f3368c847f845ef
(cherry picked from commit 40f4438f9baa945e451f8a9fc682efe3fdf9b8f7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-25 23:15:01.000000000', 'message': 'Install only the necessary files during a DevStack gate run

Previously, we installed all files in contrib/devstack, which includes
a sample localrc file which should not be used.

Change-Id: I5e73a42509e339e3f1a576b3e44ee00413fa566c
'}]
commit_message:
Install only the necessary files during a DevStack gate run

Previously, we installed all files in contrib/devstack, which includes
a sample localrc file which should not be used.

Change-Id: I5e73a42509e339e3f1a576b3e44ee00413fa566c

commit_message:
libvirt: add support for per-vCPU pinning in guest XML

Expand LibvirtConfigGuestCPUTune to allow setting of a
cpu mask per-vCPU

Blueprint: virt-driver-cpu-pinning
Change-Id: I547be6c7da4e3ebc9759f8310cb6282ac4b2f50c

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-03 21:25:28.000000000', 'message': 'devstack exercise for deletion, dns checking

This adds record and domain deletion to the designate.sh devstack
exercise.  This also adds DNS checking for the domain/record operations,
to verify that the changes were made in DNS.  Some functions in
designate.sh were moved to lib/designate and refactored slightly.

Closes-Bug: #1326141
Change-Id: Ibb86b0b237b3d73a145733bc88dbc18dddbc20f5
'}, {'created': '2014-06-03 21:48:54.000000000', 'message': 'devstack exercise for deletion, dns checking

exercise.  This also adds DNS checking for the domain/record operations,
to verify that the changes were made in DNS.  Some functions in
designate.sh were moved to lib/designate and refactored slightly.

Closes-Bug: #1326141

commit_message:
devstack exercise for deletion, dns checking

This adds record and domain deletion to the designate.sh devstack
exercise.  This also adds DNS checking for the domain/record operations,
to verify that the changes were made in DNS.  Some functions in
designate.sh were moved to lib/designate and refactored slightly.
This also removes some IPA variables that were refactored into a
backend specific file, and fixes a bug in the ipa backend file.

Closes-Bug: #1326141
Change-Id: Ibb86b0b237b3d73a145733bc88dbc18dddbc20f5
(cherry picked from commit 05291ddbf59f638870a561b1182908b676d92832)

commit_message:
libvirt: remove VIF driver classes deprecated in Icehouse

In Icehouse the old VIF driver classes were set as deprecated
to be removed in Juno. Now they can be finally deleted.

Related-bug: #1302796
Change-Id: I7be735062e6cc6aa54dec1bf43d3cce1ac544988

commit_message:
Reduce number of points in generated charts

In some cases number of iterations is too much for direct charting.

Also reduce number of digits after the decimal point.

Change-Id: I7ae526ae41500a8a0c33a7014e93cde210687df9

subject: Add the new Keystone TokenModel

[{'created': '2014-07-15 02:14:54.000000000', 'message': 'Add the new KeystoneTokenModel

This commit adds the new KeystoneTokenModel that will be used to
unify in-memory references for tokens. This model is designed to
support loading tokens from the older-legacy forms (via token
persistence), serialized format (json), and from the new format.

This new model is the base implementation with no change to the
provider or token api to utilize it.

Change-Id: I341e03ac8483f8d6085f4c2c218a28647b9ff2e4

commit_message:
Add the new Keystone TokenModel

This commit adds the new Keystone TokenModel that will be used to
unify in-memory references for tokens. The initial implementation
of this model works similarly to the AccessInfo model from
keystoneclient, providing a unified set of properties that will
return the data from the token-version specific locations.

Future development will round this model out to be better suited
as an authoratative token data source that can be transformed into
any token format / version.

Change-Id: I341e03ac8483f8d6085f4c2c218a28647b9ff2e4
bp: non-persistent-tokens

commit_message:
Silences the output in CLI for connection info

This change try to reduce the useless urllib3 connection info in
CLI by set the log level of urllib3.connectionpool.

Change-Id: I9d21d29ae0274133099dd05a14e5211d77ffe721
Closes-Bug: #1333485

In some circumstances, more than one CA certificate may need to be
installed in order to enable proper SSL connections internally

'}, {'created': '2014-07-25 22:28:38.000000000', 'message': 'ssl: Add support for multiple CA certificates

In some circumstances, more than one CA certificate may need to be
installed in order to enable proper SSL connections internally
(i.e. OpenStack services communicating with each other) and
externally (i.e. Keystone communicating with LDAPS, or Cinder with
an SSL-enabled Zadara).

This change turns the single SSLCACertificate input into a
CommaDelimitedList value.

Change-Id: I59317629d53f5cfb2ad07cee08015784eafb5a57

commit_message:
ssl: Add support for multiple CA certificates

In some circumstances, more than one CA certificate may need to be
installed in order to enable proper SSL connections internally
(i.e. OpenStack services communicating with each other) and
externally (i.e. Keystone communicating with LDAPS, or Cinder with
an SSL-enabled Zadara).

This change turns the single SSLCACertificate input into a
CommaDelimitedList value.

Change-Id: I59317629d53f5cfb2ad07cee08015784eafb5a57

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-25 15:49:10.000000000', 'message': 'Do not allow wheels for stable tests

The tests against stable versions of consuming projects download the
release packages from the PyPI mirror. Now that there are wheels
available, installing those packages breaks. Rather than completely
rewrite the test scripts, force the sdist to be downloaded.

Change-Id: I574610b934a40aa4e4c017d1f247cc14b81a8160
'}]
commit_message:
Do not allow wheels for stable tests

The tests against stable versions of consuming projects download the
release packages from the PyPI mirror. Now that there are wheels
available, installing those packages breaks. Rather than completely
rewrite the test scripts, force the sdist to be downloaded.

Change-Id: I574610b934a40aa4e4c017d1f247cc14b81a8160

commit_message:
remove static files from docs

Since we are already using oslosphinx, there is no reason to
host our own version of the usual static files.

Change-Id: Id5a88a8bae17a6de3b10961f4db3314728588372

[{'created': '2014-07-25 05:18:13.000000000', 'message': "Change V2 image tests to actually run V2 image code

The current tests for image do not run v2 image code, changing
that portion also made it's only test fail.
I opted to change the image delete code and not the test, since
passing the object ID is more in line with the rest of the
project code.

Change-Id: I62e13c063a5d68279dbbf31e59266db6285d73bf
"}]
commit_message:
Change V2 image tests to actually run V2 image code

The current tests for image do not run v2 image code, changing
that portion also made it's only test fail.
I opted to change the image delete code and not the test, since
passing the object ID is more in line with the rest of the
project code.

Change-Id: I62e13c063a5d68279dbbf31e59266db6285d73bf

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2014-07-20 13:27:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-20 14:24:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

commit_message:
Arch Design: Do not abbreviate OS in headings

Use 'operating system' in a consistent way in titles and remove the only
two usages of OS.

Change-Id: I5cbb6b6223820eedfdb8042dce14b2f439fc7d1c

[{'created': '2014-07-03 11:01:34.000000000', 'message': 'OVS agent: Correct bridge setup ordering

This patch fixes three issues that combined to break tunnel networks.

The first issue was the the failure mode was being set on the
integration bridge after the canary flow was installed. This
immediately wiped out the canary flow.

The second problem was that the main loop would sync tunnel networks
right before resetting the tunnel bridge when the canary flow was
missing. This meant that it would sync all of the tunnels via RPC and
then wipe them out.

The final issue was that after resetting the tunnel bridge in the
main loop, the tunnel_sync variable was not set to True, so the
tunnels would never be resynchronized.

This patch addresses the three issues in the following ways:
1. Set the failure mode on the bridge before the canary flow is
installed.
2. Run the OVS restart logic before the tunnel synchronization.
3. If the restart logic is triggered, set tunnel_sync to True to
trigger synchronization.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_tunnel.py

Closes-Bug: #1292105
Change-Id: I6381e3fee49910127c420dd2e3205c64cdb9e185
(cherry-picked from commit 0e5c50ecb2e2317ca6908a9bcec3bcb8ca6d3af8)
